With a fixation on raising the bar with innovation and building belonging through our culture, our team is rallying our company around a unique purpose: to create joy around each table and inspire a healthier tomorrow for every community. Albertsons Companies is one of the largest food and drug retailers in the United States, with over 2,200 stores in 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, Shaw's, Acme, Tom Thumb, Randalls, United Supermarkets, Pavilions, Star Market, Haggen, Carrs, Kings Food Markets, and Balducci's Food Lovers Market. We support our stores with 22 distribution centers and 19 manufacturing plants. Placing a premium on adaptability, safety and family well-being, our work model, Presence with a Purpose, offers a hybrid work environment between remote work and office time. A one-size-fits-all approach does not apply to everyone, and teams are empowered to make decisions best for them. Bring your flavor Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table. What you will be doing Our growing Health team is looking for a Data Analyst, Health and Customer Insights. In this position, you will help to advance our purpose to inspire wellbeing by uncovering insights that allow us to make health more accessible. You will be a key collaborator within the Health Business, supplying reporting around food program initiatives, developing financial modeling based on analytical forecasts, and reporting on customer interactions with our internally developed Health app, Sincerely Health. You will gain a deep understanding of our customers and use that knowledge to derive insights about new initiatives. This role will allow you to interact closely with the Product and Customer Engagement teams, and to help measure successes and provide feedback loops for new launches. As a Data Analyst on the health team, you will work with external and internal data sets to synthesize insights, build models, and perform analysis to support the business. Successful candidates will be comfortable working with ambiguity to distill simple insights from complex data and can work independently to drive decisions forward with key stakeholders. The position will be based in Boise, Idaho, or one of our main regional offices (Seattle, WA, Portland, OR, Pleasanton CA, Denver CO, Dallas TX, Chicago, IL, Fullerton, CA, or Phoenix, AZ). Main responsibilities Research and analysis – gather, clean, and normalize data from disparate sources into workable data models using various tools. Advanced SQL- Use SQL to source insights from derived datasets, not from simple aggregation, and work using efficient coding practices for a Big Data environment. Collaborate with leadership and business partners to streamline reporting requirements within existing data models. Lead analyses that involve complex analytics to solve a variety of business issues that may have cross-functional impact. Develop recommendations on initiatives for Health that promote adoption of Health and Pharmacy services to increase retention and grow share of wallet with our customers. Present key findings and making recommendations based on data, communicating business performance in a clear and insightful way to the business to facilitate timely and informed decision making. Be curious. Work with the team to ideate and scope big ideas that can help the business drive accelerated portfolio growth and engagement. Be customer first. Innovate digital and in-store interactions to benefit our customers and increase engagement. The salary range is $72,100 to $93,000 annually. Starting salary will vary based on criteria such as location, experience, and qualifications. There may be flexibility for exceptional candidates. Benefits may include medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance, sick pay, PTO/Vacation pay/Flexible Time Off, paid holidays (8-9 days annually) bereavement pay and retirement benefits (such as 401(k) eligibility. A copy of the full job description can be made available to you. What we are searching for Flexible self-starter and team player who works well in various situations (from well-defined to unstructured) and proactively identifies business improvement areas. Advanced skills in SQL and Microsoft Power BI (or similar data-vis software). Ability to manage competing priorities and multi-task to meet deadlines. Entrepreneurial mindset. Thrives in ambiguous work environments with an ability to bring structure and process, identify opportunities for improvement, define goals and outcomes, drive action, and achieve results. Excellent attention to detail and ability to submit error-free deliverables. Strategic bent with the curiosity and ability to understand our customers, partners, and industry to help arrive at the right building blocks for future growth. Strong problem-solving skills. Thinks strategically with an ability to execute. Ability to manage competing priorities and multi-task to meet deadlines. Advanced skills in Excel for ad hoc analysis. We believe the successful candidate has these qualifications and experience: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline is preferred (computer science, business, finance) but other disciplines or equivalent experience will be considered. 3+ years of experience in data analysis or data science. Experience with customer journey, retail, pharmacy are a plus. Experience and advanced experience with Data Visualization tools required (Power BI, Tableau, or a similar tools). Expertise in SQL is required. Proficiency in Microsoft Suite Applications for ad hoc reporting and presentations, with advanced Excel for analytics knowledge. Experience using JIRA for project management a plus. Some travel may be required, up to 5%. What is it like at Albertsons? Our 290,000 associates have a passion for great service and building lasting relationships with our customers. Through a companywide focus on innovation, we are continually enhancing our digital and product offerings, making it easy for customers to get what they need, wherever they are. title: Data Analyst
description: Data Analysts will be responsible for analyzing and problem solving as its relates to data, types of data, metadata, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system. This role interacts with end users and reporting analysts to understand key data entities and data structures in capturing detailed data requirements. They will identify correlations between raw enterprise data and management, so data extraction, analysis and transformations are used as actionable intelligence. Data analysts may receive requests from all members of the Bank including the management team and must have strong task prioritization skills in addition to good statistical and critical thinking skills. Data analysts will often assist in complex modeling to properly present data. Data analysts are responsible for consulting and assisting with project analysis, program design, report writing, scripting, dictionary synchronization, and other technical maters required for computer applications. Data analysts will create models and data sets that adhere to written standards and best practices, and fully test and document to assure expected results. The position requires strong data analysis, problem-solving, business process, time management, reporting skills and knowledge of R, SQL and/or Python. Essential Functions A data analyst with some experience is required, who has a strong background in client and team requirements gathering. The post holder will be part of the information strategy team. Responsibilities will be expected to be developed and finalized over time and will include but will not be restricted to leading and carrying out: Working under the supervision of the Data Management manager, partner with key business users and stakeholders to define data migration requirements, resolve data issues and validate procedures and results Identify, document and validate data migration scope, data requirements and system/ infrastructure solutions Define source system data requirements, data quality issues/fixes and business rules Map and specify target data requirements and associated data transformations Test data migration results and validate migration with key users and business analysts Be a self-starter with solid interpersonal skills - projecting a very positive customer-service-oriented attitude Adhere to processes and policies Assist in the creation of dashboards for senior management Develop automation or efficiencies in production and monitoring reports Assist in creating and maintaining department procedures Monitor and analyze the Bank’s business lines and provide reporting to senior management Create insights from external datasets; market, industry, geographic and economic Participate and enhance the current method of Bank reporting Preparation of models for senior management Ability to become proficient in the Bank’s CRM tool, Salesforce Assist with document gathering for loan sales, participations and pledged assets Participate in any current and future department goals Assist supervisor on any ad hoc requests JOB QUALIFICATIONS Experience with mapping source to target systems with large data models Strong SQL abilities for database query and reporting Expert in Excel and proficient in other MS Office tools Ability to understand and work with large quantities of data to identify trends, errors and gaps Ability to multi-task and manage concurrent projects in various stages of development Impeccable customer service and interpersonal skills and excellent written and verbal communications skills mandatory Experience in customer management, contracts, product, pricing, invoicing and commissions preferred Experience with ERP systems preferred Experience with agile project management techniques preferred Experience with data governance, master data management, data warehouse and business intelligence preferred About Northern Bank & Trust Company Northern Bank is a full-service bank dedicated to providing practical, common sense financial solutions to help our customers live their lives and grow their businesses. Founded in 1960, Northern Bank has assets of over $3 billion with 13 locations serving communities throughout Middlesex County. Northern Bank is a Member of the FDIC, and an Equal Housing Lender. title: Sr. Data Analyst
description: Position Overview The Data Analyst works as part of the Data Platform Team within the Data & Analytics Group. The primary responsibilities are to analyze enterprise and vendor datasets, understand data characteristics and methodologies, and collaborate across business and technology teams to manage data onboarding and data lifecycle. The analyst will work on analyzing data profiles and data cleansing and quality check requirements, working with the dev team to build and enhance data pipelines while maintaining proper quality and control around the data sets. Primary Responsibilities Collaborate across teams to implement data governance policies for data ingestion and operational processes. Manage data sets to the defined rules and controls. Develop/implement new rules and controls as needed. Remediate data issues. Address quality issues surfaced in the data set, engage vendors and stakeholders where necessary. Define data policies and controls for new data requirements. Analyze and document data methodologies and data feed structures related to internal and external data sources. Provide Data Ownership and subject matter expertise for reference data and aggregate data. Provide data quality metrics for guidance on Enterprise data sets. Establish working relationship with key stakeholders and manage stakeholder expectations. Provide thought leadership and participate in projects that enhance/improve data life cycles, processes, quality, and governance. Identify and document data quality problems and opportunities to improve data quality controls via data profiling and advanced analysis. Document, assess, influence, and synthesize business requirements to develop and advance data platform and stewardship capabilities. Translate complex business requirements into focused technical requirements and data solutions. Conduct detailed UAT against complex requirements and data structures. Work closely with developers to resolve issues discovered via testing and develop solutions to address logic/design deficiencies. Key Qualifications / Skills Extensive hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting investment data with strong knowledge of the Investment Management industry 10+ years of Investment Management experience. Comprehensive data analysis skills with ability to detect anomalies, patterns, and data quality issues. Strong SQL skills Experience with Snowflake is a plus. Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively in both formal and informal contexts tailored for the audience. Knowledge of Data Governance & Data Quality and the relevant tools. Hands-on experience in project management Ability to manage enterprise scale data projects. Preferred Skills Experience working with BI reporting tools like Tableau or Power BI is preferred. Knowledge in coding, Python is a plus. Familiar with agile process and JIRA Spruce Technology, Inc. is a mid-size, award-winning (Inc 5000, SmartCEO, Entrepreneur of the Year) technology services firm with a steadily growing portfolio of commercial and government clients. Spruce provides innovative technology solutions, specialized IT staff, and IT strategy consulting nationwide. Spruce maintains partnerships with major technology vendors and continually develops leading-edge offerings in service areas such as digital experience, data services, application development, infrastructure, cyber security, and IT staffing. Spruce Technology, Inc. is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. title: Data Analyst
description: Roadie, a UPS Company, is a logistics management and crowdsourced delivery platform. Founded in 2014, Roadie offers businesses fast, flexible and asset-light logistics solutions for last-mile delivery. Roadie enables local delivery to more than 95% of U.S. households by providing access to more than 200,000 independent drivers nationwide – allowing businesses to offer their customers delivery optionality for almost any industry, from airlines to artisans. Roadie is looking for a Data Analyst who will be responsible for delivering analyses and actionable insights that directly support company decision making. This individual will work cross-functionally to measure, assess, and monitor key business metrics, working with datasets across a variety of systems applying analytical skills to support our teams and achieve company goals. As an early member of the analytics team, you’ll have many opportunities to make a meaningful impact by helping develop how we do analytics as a company. The ideal candidate brings prior experience in a startup environment in an analytics role. Not everything has been built yet and data might be messy, but your self-motivated nature is hyperfocused on designing a system for reliable metrics. What You’ll Do Deliver analyses and build dashboards that expose deep understanding of key business metrics across Roadie’s various datasets Perform analyses and develop visualizations using BI Tools Develop and deliver dashboards that provide insights that inform product and business decision making Partner with business stakeholders providing clarity and guidance on various analyses Build custom external dashboards for enterprise clients to support customer engagement and expansion Execute on various ad hoc analytics requests Collaborate cross-functionally to align metrics and reporting Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and data visualization with a focus on actionable analytics What You Bring 2+ years relevant experience in analytics or business intelligence role Bachelor’s degree in quantitative field Strong analytical skills and experience with reporting and data analysis Expertise in SQL with ability to build complex queries across platforms Experience with data visualization tools & with Excel High attention to detail, accuracy, and reliability Strong communication skills, with ability to articulate and present complex analysis with technical and non-technical stakeholders Curiosity asking hard questions and seeking answers in the data A bias for action, thriving in a fast-paced environment Bonus Experience with R or Python and desire to continue to build expertise Why Roadie? Competitive compensation packages 100% covered health insurance premiums for yourself 401k with company match Tuition and student loan repayment assistance (that’s right - Roadie will contribute directly to your existing student loans!) Flexible work schedule with unlimited PTO Monthly 3-day weekends Monthly WFH stipend Paid sabbatical leave- tenured team members are given time to rest, relax, and explore The technology you need to get the job done

title: Analista de Dados
description: Job Description Estamos procurando gente fora da curva, que queira construir um produto que seja referência na área de tecnologia. Além do básico, alguém que consiga pensar o produto, agregar com novas ideias, sempre pensando na melhor solução para o cliente final. Usamos tecnologia para automatizar o abastecimento da casa das pessoas. Nosso objetivo é criar um mundo onde os produtos essenciais cheguem na sua casa com a mesma facilidade que a água chega na torneira. Com nosso modelo de compras planejadas já fizeram nossos clientes economizarem mais de 30 milhões. Mas nossa plataforma de recorrência é apenas o primeiro passo nesse caminho (ainda tem muitos produtos inovadores no forno). E aí, o que achou? Vem fazer parte de um time onde você não será só mais 1! Responsibilities and assignments Analisar grandes conjuntos de dados para identificar padrões e tendências de compra; Gerar insights acionáveis para otimizar estratégias de vendas e marketing; Colaborar com as equipes de marketing e operações para implementar soluções baseadas em dados; Monitorar o desempenho das estratégias e propor ajustes conforme necessário. Requirements And Qualifications Mentalidade data-driven com habilidades analíticas sólidas; Domínio básico de programação em Python ou SQL para manipulação e análise de dados; Conhecimento em ferramentas de Dataviz: Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio e similares; Conhecimento em Google Analytics; Habilidade avançada em Excel para análise de dados e criação de relatórios; Capacidade de comunicar insights complexos de forma clara e concisa; Capacidade de trabalhar de forma autônoma e em equipe em um ambiente dinâmico; Desejável: Pelo menos 1 ano de experiência no mercado de varejo, preferencialmente em análise de dados. Desejável: Conhecimentos de índices e métricas de marketing como: LTV, RFV, Cohort, Growth, Fidelização, CAC, Retenção, ROI, etc. Additional information Vaga também para PCD. Process stages Step 1: Registration1Registration Step 2: Teste de Lógica2Teste de Lógica Step 3: Queremos te conhecer melhor!3Queremos te conhecer melhor! Step 4: Queremos que você conheça a área!4Queremos que você conheça a área! Step 5: Cultura Shopper5Cultura Shopper Step 6: Hiring6Hiring SOMOS MAIS QUE UM SUPERMERCADO! Somos a startup que já economizou mais de R$ 30 milhões a milhares de brasileiros e dobra de tamanho a cada 3 meses, desde sua fundação (em 2015). Em 2021 conseguimos levantar cerca de R$300 milhões em duas rodadas de investimento com gente fora da curva, como José Galló (ex-CEO da Renner), GIC, Ariel Lambrecht (fundador da 99 e da Yellow), Minerva Foods, entre outros. Acreditamos que um país melhor é feito de empresas mais eficientes e de pessoas que trocam velhos hábitos por escolhas mais inteligentes. E trabalhamos por isso. Por essa visão de país melhor, aplicada ao setor que atinge a todos os brasileiros: o setor de produtos essenciais de consumo, mais conhecido como "setor supermercadista". Mas esqueça esse nome: "supermercado". Somos mais que isso. Somos um sistema de reabastecimento. E queremos ser o maior e melhor sistema de reabastecimento do Brasil. Esse é nosso sonho. "Um mundo onde os produtos essenciais cheguem na sua casa com a mesma facilidade que a água chega na torneira" Quer participar desse sonho com a gente?
summary: This job description seeks a data-driven individual to join a fast-growing startup focused on automating grocery delivery.  Responsibilities include analyzing large datasets to identify buying patterns, generating actionable insights for sales and marketing optimization, collaborating with teams to implement data-driven solutions, and monitoring strategy performance. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, basic programming skills in Python or SQL, experience with data visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker Studio, and proficiency in Excel for data analysis and reporting.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data Analyst Location: Dallas, Charlotte, or Lake Murray (Work From Home) Start Date: 9/30 Job Description: CornerStone TTS is seeking a motivated Data Analyst to join our team. This role is perfect for candidates looking for a change and who are ready to start by September 30th. The position offers the flexibility to work remotely and is based in either Dallas, Charlotte, or Lake Murray. Responsibilities: 1. Research and Resolve Data Issues: Handle data exceptions, validations, and field escalations from batch and API traffic. This requires understanding data integration and API interactions. 2. Manage Datasets: Improve and create datasets in rules engines across multiple products and offerings. Technical skills in data management and manipulation within rules engines are necessary. 3. Data Analysis: Interpret data, analyze results, filter, and clean data. Proficiency in tools and techniques for data manipulation and analysis is required. 4. Trend Analysis: Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. Analytical skills to recognize patterns and trends in data are essential. 5. Technical Documentation: Document and maintain business and functional requirements, ensuring accuracy and persistence. Minimum Requirements: - Analytical Skills: Strong ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. - Technical Proficiency: Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Google Productivity Apps (Google Docs, Sheets, Slides). Preferred Qualifications (Not Required): - API Experience: Familiarity with APIs, using SoapUI, PostMan, or similar applications. - SQL Knowledge: Experience with SQL or a similar querying language. - EDI Experience: Understanding and experience with EDI systems for electronic transactions. - HIPAA Knowledge: Understanding of HIPAA regulations for handling healthcare data securely. Why Join Us? - Flexible Remote Work: Opportunity to work remotely, providing a better work-life balance. - Professional Growth: Engage in challenging projects that enhance your technical skills and career development. - Dynamic Environment: Join a team-oriented and adaptable workplace where your contributions are valued. Apply Now! If you have strong analytical skills and experience in data analysis, and you're looking for a rewarding new opportunity, we want to hear from you! Submit your application today and join CornerStone TTS as we make a difference through data.
summary: CornerStone TTS seeks a motivated Data Analyst to join their team. This role involves data analysis, management, and resolving data issues using various tools and techniques. The candidate will work remotely from Dallas, Charlotte, or Lake Murray.

title: Data Analyst
description: ABOUT CAMPUS MULTIMEDIA, LLC Campus Multimedia, LLC is an Alpharetta, GA-based, sponsorships sales representation firm working with national brands to accelerate revenue growth through integrated marketing programs and custom K-12 school communication channels. Campus Multimedia’s core purpose is to support and improve the school experience for students, teachers, and school districts through strategic brand partnership programs tailored to their needs. Our extensive network of 100,000+ school relationships creates unparalleled impact for brands to step inside schools at scale with mutually beneficial goals. As the leader in school marketing execution, Campus Multimedia creates platforms for brands to achieve their goals and schools to receive resources. Learn more at campusmultimedia.com ABOUT THE ROLE We are looking for a Data Analyst who is highly skilled in all aspects of analytics including mining, generation, processing, and visualization. Additionally, this person should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-oriented reporting that drives innovation and growth. This role will support internal and external stakeholders and requires a high degree of self-motivation, organization, attention to detail, and proactive problem-solving. You will collaborate closely with the Sales, Partnerships, and Marketing teams and will report to the VP of Business Intelligence. PRIMARY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES Design, document, test, create, and maintain complex data systems supporting research, ad-hoc querying, and management of large-scale sponsorship programs. Create stored procedures, functions, calculations, and report definitions to analyze custom datasets, distinguish patterns, and identify potential business opportunities. Collaborate closely with internal teams and business partners to gather detailed program requirements, including data source mapping, data cleansing rules, third-party data integration, and validation. Communicate data nuances, narratives, and insights to all company levels clearly and concisely. Regularly document and conduct quality testing and recommend solutions for handling inconsistent data. Construct and maintain dashboards that support client programs and enhance reporting for internal and external stakeholders. Ensure high-quality project completion on schedule with short deadlines. Other duties as assigned. CULTURAL FIT Must embody Campus Multimedia values of I.M.P.A.C.T., demonstrating our ability to deliver value to our customers, create measurable change in our industry, and positively influence our colleagues and partners: Integrity – Do the right thing every time. Modernization - Courageously pursue progress. People First – Care big. Celebrate big. Accountability – Proactively OWN IT! Communication – Intentional Transparency Teamwork – Together, Everyone Wins THIS ROLE REQUIRES: A Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration or a related field. 1-4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role. Experience in SQL for querying large datasets and Python for statistical analysis. Experience working with cloud-based data systems, relational databases and APIs. Strong proficiency in Tableau and data visualization for storytelling. Candidates who are proactive, well-organized, and possess a strong work ethic with a willingness to learn and adapt in a dynamic and rapidly evolving startup environment. IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU HAVE: A Masters Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Administration or a related field. Experience with Salesforce Data Cloud and/or Marketing Cloud. Familiarity with geospatial analysis. Understanding of ETL processes and third-party data integration. Experience with AI/ML or front-end/back-end programming. For more information or to apply, please contact or send a resume to Justin Freeman, Vice President, Business Intelligence at justinf@campusmultimedia.com
summary: Campus Multimedia, an Alpharetta, GA-based sponsorships sales representation firm, seeks a Data Analyst to analyze large datasets, build data systems, create reports, and develop dashboards for internal and external stakeholders. The role involves collaboration with sales, partnerships, and marketing teams, and requires strong SQL, Python, Tableau, and data visualization skills.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Sr. Data Analyst Location/ Work Structure: Westerville, OH, Who we are: Vernovis is a Total Talent Solutions company that specializes in Technology, Cybersecurity, Finance & Accounting functions. At Vernovis, we help these professionals achieve their career goals, matching them with innovative projects and dynamic direct hire opportunities in Ohio and across the Midwest. Client Overview: Vernovis partnering with a growing company to find a Sr. Data Analyst. What You'll Do: Pull together data sources, generate metrics, and build dashboards for decision making and reporting. Gather data from various sources (databases, APIs, files), ensuring quality, completeness, and accuracy. Clean, filter, and transform data for analysis. Apply statistical and analytical techniques to interpret data, identify trends, patterns, and relationships, and support decision-making. Provide ongoing reports and insights. Create and present reports, dashboards, and data visualizations (charts, graphs, plots) to communicate findings effectively to stakeholders. Maintain data analytics platforms and perform ad hoc querying. Use various tools (SQL, PostgreSQL, Grafana, Prometheus, Pandas, Power BI, Python, PowerShell, APIs) for data manipulation and extraction. Present BI solutions, create documentation, and lead end-user training sessions. What Experience You'll Have: 3+ years of experience in the data analytics realm Bachelor’s degree in computer science, data science, information technology, or related fields, OR relevant experience. Strong skills in SQL, PostgreSQL for extracting data from SQL databases. Experience with dashboard reporting tools (Grafana and Power BI preferred). Proficiency in data-centric design, development, modeling, automation, ETL processes, and handling large datasets. What Experience is Nice to Have: Experience with Grafana, Power BI, Prometheus, Pandas, Python, PowerShell, and API interaction: The Vernovis Difference: Vernovis offers Health, Dental, Vision, Voluntary Short & Long -Term Disability, Voluntary Life Insurance, and 401K. Vernovis does not accept inquiries from Corp to Corp recruiting companies. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis and not violate any immigration or discrimination laws. Vernovis provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.
summary: This job posting seeks a Sr. Data Analyst to join a growing company. Responsibilities include data extraction, analysis, reporting, and visualization, using tools such as SQL, PostgreSQL, Grafana, Prometheus, Power BI, Python, PowerShell, and APIs. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of experience, a bachelor's degree in a related field, and strong skills in SQL and dashboard reporting.

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description: Job Summary: Our client is seeking a Power BI Data Analyst who will gather retail operations data from multiple databases, platforms, stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors to complete analyze. The ideal candidate will transform large data sets through data wrangling, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modeling. This job is located in Cincinnati, Ohio. Duties: Standardize data processes and quality Assist in developing business reporting Increase data availability, standardization, and automation processes Problem solve and investigate issues Participate in all phases of system testing Work successfully in an agile project across multiple feature and component teams Complete estimates and work plans in Program Increments (PI) Meetings as appropriate for design, development, implementation, and rollout tasks Desired Skills/Experience: Experience with R, including data cleaning, performing calculations on large datasets, and performing exploratory data analysis Python PowerBI Experience working with Power Query, Dataflows, Row Level Security (RLS), and writing measures with DAX Eye for visualization and a focus on the user experience Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Vision Insurance Plans 401K offered

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: he Senior Enterprise Data Analyst will play a key role in enhancing the corporation’s analytical capabilities across various business functions. This role will work closely with a diverse team comprising data scientists, analytical sponsors, analytics translators, data engineers, and other stakeholders to drive strategic data-driven initiatives enterprise-wide. RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Conduct complex data analysis to support the development of actionable insights that enhance business performance across various enterprise functions. 2. Develop and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track enterprise-wide performance and identify emerging trends. 3. Create and manage operational and executive dashboards for various business touchpoints. 4. Present analytical findings to analytical sponsors and key stakeholders to facilitate strategic decision-making. 5. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, and business stakeholders, to identify reporting needs, optimization opportunities, and strategic improvements. 6. Assist analytics teams with creating and reviewing dashboards using tools like Tableau and Power BI. 7. Ensure data integrity across multiple channels and sources. 8. Apply visualization strategies to derive and communicate business insights effectively. 9. Perform in-depth quantitative analysis to identify key trends, emerging issues, and opportunities for process improvement. 10. Utilize advanced statistical and analytical techniques to support senior managers and executives in answering business-critical questions and making informed decisions. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. Master’s degree preferred. Five (5) years of experience in operations research, statistical analysis, business analysis, or related fields. SKILLS: Advanced skill in the use of Microsoft Office Suite, including Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Access. Proficiency in analytical tools such as SQL, MicroStrategy, Tableau, and Power BI. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet objectives and deadlines. Ability to maintain effective and professional internal and external relationships. DESIRABLE: Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Operations Research, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field. Certificate within Statistical Analysis, Business Analytics, Predictive Analytics, Market Research or related areas. Specific experience related to enterprise-wide data analytics and business intelligence.
summary: The Senior Enterprise Data Analyst will lead data analysis efforts across various business functions, generating actionable insights and driving strategic initiatives. This role involves collaborating with diverse teams, including data scientists and engineers, to develop KPIs, create dashboards, and present analytical findings to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills and proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, and SQL.

title: Data Analyst
description: Responsibilities Kforce has a client that is seeking a Data Analyst in Fort Collins, CO. Responsibilities: Data Analyst will apply intermediate level of subject matter knowledge to solve a variety of common business issues Works on problems of moderately complex scope Acts as an informed team member providing analysis of information and limited project direction input Exercises independent judgment within defined practices and procedures to determine appropriate action Follows established guidelines and interprets policies Evaluates unique circumstances and makes recommendations Participates as a member of team of other data science engineers carrying out the investigation, design, development, execution, and implementation of data science projects to generate new insights, products, technologies, and intellectual property In accordance with plan, performs/executes data collection and analysis procedures and data insight visualizations for assigned projects As a Data Analyst, you will collaborate with internal and external partners to perform experiments and validations in accordance with overall plan Collects, records, and analyzes data using established protocols and processes; Communicates findings to other team members for review and feedback Assists in literature and presentations for peer review, publication, and delivery at industry and scientific events and conferences; Creates patent applications and supporting documentation Using scientific design and data collection methodologies, tools, and analysis packages to collect, validate, and analyze research data Collaborates with peers, junior data scientists and engineers, SMEs and external and internal research and product development partners Requirements Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent Typically, 2-4 years of experience Understanding of design, scientific procedures and processes, and data analysis Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language Ability to apply analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to effectively communicate research plans, proposals, and results, and negotiate options The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports to support business decision-making. This role requires proficiency in data manipulation, visualization, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. Roles And Responsibilities Data Collection and Cleaning: Collect, preprocess, and clean data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness. Identify and address data quality issues and inconsistencies. Data Analysis and Interpretation: Perform exploratory data analysis to discover trends, patterns, and correlations in datasets. Apply statistical methods and quantitative techniques to analyze data and generate insights. Data Visualization and Reporting: Create informative and visually appealing dashboards, reports, and presentations to communicate findings. Present data and analysis results in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders. Business Insights and Recommendations: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven insights. Translate complex data analysis into actionable recommendations to support strategic decisions. Performance Monitoring and Forecasting: Develop and maintain KPIs and metrics to monitor business performance. Build predictive models and forecasting tools to support planning and decision-making. Database Management and Querying: Manage and query databases using SQL and other data manipulation languages. Optimize data queries and processes to improve efficiency and performance. Continuous Improvement: Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization. Propose and implement process improvements and automation initiatives. Collaboration and Teamwork: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, marketing, and operations, to support data-related projects and initiatives. Participate in team meetings, brainstorming sessions, and knowledge sharing activities. Skills And Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field; Master's degree preferred. X+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of data analysis techniques and methodologies. Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as Excel, Python, R, or SQL. Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create interactive dashboards and reports. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and derive meaningful insights. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts and analysis results to non-technical stakeholders. Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality in data analysis and reporting. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, with a focus on delivering actionable insights. Compensation The salary for this position is competitive and commensurate with experience. Benefits package includes health insurance, retirement plan options, paid time off, and professional development opportunities. Application Process Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your qualifications and interest in this position. We will contact selected candidates for further interviews. This job description is crafted to attract qualified candidates for a Data Analyst position by outlining specific responsibilities, required skills, and offering details about compensation and benefits. Adjustments can be made based on the company's industry, size, and specific data analysis needs, such as specialization in particular domains (e.g., healthcare analytics, financial data analysis).
summary: We are searching for a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and create reports for business decision-making. Responsibilities include data collection, cleaning, analysis, visualization, reporting, business insights, performance monitoring, and database management. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in data manipulation, visualization, and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

title: Data Analyst I
description: Responsibilities: Work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. Strongest skill sets include SQL and Excel. Ability to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions. Look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings. Skills: Problem solving effectively Multi-tasking in fast paced environment with sometimes little turnaround time Organizational skills Confident and comfortable working with inconsistent data sets Diligent Moving quickly and deliberately, using data to guide decisions and testing to achieve breakthroughs Communicating directly, sharing feedback at all levels, and engaging in debate while maintaining objectivity Extract, load and transform data from multiple sources for global compliance reporting Validate and verify data attributes via third party tools, internal tools, and via weblinks Examine data quality issues for consistency and accuracy, identify resolutions Investigate inconsistencies Participate in testing for various test cases a set of reporting requirements by jurisdiction Tech Skills Required: Understanding of common reporting and file transfer technologies Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, Excel (e.g.vlookups, sumifs,pivots) Experience with Power BI, a plus Experience with the use of various data analytic tools Desired Skills: Experience in the platform or gig economy Two sided marketplaces Compliance reporting Compensation: The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on several factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, competencies, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements). Benefits and Ancillaries: Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee.
summary: Data Analyst responsible for analyzing large datasets, extracting insights, and generating reports for compliance purposes. Requires strong SQL, Excel, and data visualization skills (Tableau preferred). Experience with data analytic tools, compliance reporting, and two-sided marketplaces is a plus.

title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence
description: Doximity is transforming the healthcare industry. Join our mission to help every physician be more productive and provide better care for their patients. As medicine's largest network in the United States, there's an elevated level of responsibility in everything we do. We don't take that responsibility lightly and are committed to building diverse teams with an inclusive culture that can make a direct impact on the healthcare system. One of Doximity's core values is stretching ourselves. Even if you don't check off all the boxes below we encourage you to apply. Doximity is full of exceptional people who bring their own unique experiences to work everyday and make us all better for it! This role can be filled in our San Francisco headquarters OR remotely in the U.S. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you'll work within cross-functional delivery teams alongside other analysts, engineers, and commercial stakeholders in discovering data insights to help improve healthcare. How you'll make an impact: Work closely with our Strategic Analytics, Client Success, and Sales teams to create client-facing analyses. Showcase your engineering skills by creating data products from scratch and automating code so they can be re-used by other teammates. Continue to improve your technical and non-technical skill sets. Leverage Doximity's extensive datasets to identify and classify behavioral patterns of medical professionals on our platform. Grow into a presentation/communication-focused role or dive deeper into more-involved technical challenges—the choice is yours. The Core Values of the Client Intelligence team As an organization we value diversity - in backgrounds and in experiences. Healthcare is a universal concern, and we need people from all backgrounds to help build a better future for all. Below are additional core values specific to the Insights Team. Collaboration —The best candidates and teammates are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth. Passion for Data —You're going to help our clients and team members with data-driven decision making. We need someone that can manipulate millions of rows of data and also ask the right questions to find the important insights. Reliability – Our team is efficient, flexible, and agile only because we trust the reliability of each member. We need self-starters and goal-oriented individuals for our continued success. Curiosity – Continuous learning is a cornerstone at Doximity, and curious individuals thrive in our environment. We're looking for someone who is curious enough about data to go above-and-beyond the task for the true insight. Respect – A key dynamic that allows our team to flourish is respect: for ourselves and our quality of work, for our teammates, and for our internal clients who are under the pressure of deadlines and finance goals. What a successful candidate must have: Three (3) years of experience illustrating the traits outlined in our core values Excellent SQL skills with proven ability to create and to evaluate complex SQL statements involving numerous tables and complex relationships. Fluent in Python and experience using common modules (numpy, pandas, statsmodels, matplotlib) for EDA. Nice to haves: Working knowledge of statistics and visualization. Experience working with data visualization tools (Looker) Advanced Excel skills Experience working in healthcare industry Experience presenting data to a non-technical audience Fun Facts About the Client Intelligence team We have access to one of the richest healthcare datasets in the world, with deep information on hundreds of thousands of clinicians and their connections. Business decisions at Doximity are driven by our data, analyses, and insights. The members of our team bring a diverse set of technical and cultural backgrounds. We like to have fun - company outings, team lunches, and other social events! Compensation The US total compensation range for this full-time position is inclusive of salary + equity. Our ranges are determined by role and level. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the approximate total target compensation for the position across the US. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including relevant skills, experience, and education/training. Please note that the compensation listed does not include benefits. More on /Benefits/Perks Doximity is proud to offer industry-leading benefits to our full time employees. Some of our offerings include: Medical, dental, vision offerings for you and your family 401k with matching program Employee stock purchase plan Family planning support, Childcare FSA, and parental leave Life, AD&D, and Disability Generous time off, holidays and paid company trips Wellness benefits…plus many more! More About Doximity… For the past decade, it's been our mission to help every physician be more productive so they can provide better care for their patients. We believe that when doctors are connected, the healthcare system works better and patients benefit. Doximity enables our verified clinician members to collaborate with colleagues, stay up-to-date with the latest medical news and research, manage their careers, and conduct virtual patient visits. Today, Doximity is the leading digital platform for U.S. medical professionals, with over 80% of physicians, 50% of all nurse practitioners and physician assistants, and 90% of graduating medical students as members. Joining Doximity means being part of an incredibly talented and humble team passionate about improving inefficiencies in our $4.3 trillion U.S. healthcare system. We are a team of doers who solve problems everyday by treating obstacles like an adventure, and we love creating technology that has a real, meaningful impact on people's lives. Doxers are committed to working towards a more equitable world both within and beyond our office walls. This starts by fostering an inclusive and diverse work environment where differences are valued and all employees are encouraged to bring their full, authentic selves to work daily. To learn more about our team, culture, and users, check out our careers page, company blog, and engineering blog. We're growing fast, and there's plenty of opportunity for you to make an impact—join us! For more information, visit Doximity.com. ____________________________________________ EEOC Statement Doximity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification. title: Compliance Data Analyst
description: Hi, we're Brigit! A holistic financial health company helping every American build a brighter financial future. With a business model that is aligned with our customers, we create transparent, fair, and simple financial products that put money back in the hands of our members, help them spend wisely, avoid unfair fees and build their credit quickly. If autonomy, ownership, and having meaningful input at the company you work for is important to you, come join our growing team! Brigit is doing innovative and exciting work, but don’t just take our word for it, our work is being recognized by others: Built In’s 2023 & 2024 Best Startups to Work For In New York City Built In’s 2024 Best Startups to Work For In the U.S. Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies of 2022 Forbes Fintech 50 2022 Business Insider’s Most Promising Consumer Startups 2022 Role Overview We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team and help drive analytics in the Compliance Team. Our product has tremendous traction helping low income Americans make ends meet and now is the time to scale. The ideal person for this role is excited about structuring our compliance testing, reporting, and data infrastructure from the ground up. Successful Analysts in this role will earn their stripes by quickly learning the company’s regulatory requirements, applying critical thinking, and taking a sense of ownership of our Compliance Testing and Report through the tools and dashboards you create. What You’ll Be Doing Design and organize data-collection efforts for the Compliance Team, specifically related to data needs for testing, monitoring, and auditing Brigit’s compliance with various rules and regulations Build Compliance Testing from the ground-up, utilizing a data-first approach in designing each test Define and create reporting dashboards Partner with colleagues facilitating the design, build, and automation of reports and dashboards that provide insight into our business Conduct insightful analysis using internal and external data (e.g. performance, risk, product, market, industry) to derive insights that will drive compliance decisions Leverage data techniques to investigate our data and gain knowledge of our users/business and educate the rest of the team What You Have Passion for and experience with quantitative coursework Minimum of 2+ years of data analytics experience is required Experience in a fast-paced consumer finance, banking, or fintech environment is required Advanced proficiency in SQL Experience with Python A general understanding of Compliance practices and needs in a fintech environment The anticipated annual base salary for this position is $100,000 - $140,000. This range does not include any other compensation components or other benefits for which an individual may be eligible. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job. Our Benefits & Team Medical, dental, and vision insurance Equity participation Flexible PTO Policy 401k plan Paid Parental Leave Physical and mental wellbeing benefits including Wellhub for access to virtual workouts and discounted gym memberships, and Headspace for covered virtual therapy sessions and unlimited on demand health support Monthly reimbursements to use against wifi and cell phone bills Annual reimbursement for Learning & Development Help hard working Americans build a brighter financial future High-growth company at an early stage A dynamic, flexible and collaborative start-up work environment with a highly talented team Brigit is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy (including breast feeding and related medical conditions), national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, genetic information, disability, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

This role involves designing data collection efforts, building compliance testing, creating reporting dashboards, and conducting insightful analysis using internal and external data. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of data analytics experience, advanced proficiency in SQL, experience with Python, and a general understanding of Compliance practices in the fintech environment.

title: Data Analyst
description: What You’ll Experience as a Data Analyst at TGG: Achieving business results as a client facing consultant for our clients in various types of engagements within a variety of industries. Delivering high quality work to our clients within our technology service line. Being part of a collaborative, values-based firm that has a reputation for great work and satisfied clients. Working with senior IT leaders to communicate strategic goals to their organization, including leading client and internal development teams on best practices. What You Will Work On: Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities for optimization. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics. Collaborate with product managers, marketers, and engineers to ideate, prioritize, and implement data-driven initiatives. Conduct A/B testing and other statistical analyses to evaluate the effectiveness of product changes. Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders through clear and concise presentations. Contribute analytical insights to inform product vision and deliver value. Who Will You Work With: Client stakeholders ranging from individual contributors to senior executives. A collaborative team of consultants that deliver outstanding client service. TGG partners, principals, account leaders, managers, and staff supporting you to excel within client projects and to achieve your professional development goals. Examples of What You Bring to the Table: Bachelor’s degree ​​in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or a related field; or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience. 0- 4 years of relevant experience. You have strong analysis capabilities, and thrive on working collaboratively to deliver successful results for clients. You should bring the following experiences and capabilities: Familiarity with source control best practices: Define, Setup/Configure, Deploy and Maintain source code (e.g. GIT, VisualSafe Source). Ability to develop and schedule processes to extract, transform, and store data from these systems: SQL databases, Azure cloud services, Google cloud service, Snowflake, or Databricks. Ability to analyze requirements, design, implement, debug, and deploy Cloud Platform services and components . Skills in handling and processing data, including data cleaning and preparation. Ability to represent data visually to facilitate understanding and decision-making. Proficiency in SQL or Python and Excel for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis. Intermediate experience with Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, Adobe Analytics, or similar BI tools. Strong understanding of statistical concepts and techniques. At least basic exposure to data science and machine learning methods. Analytical Mindset: Ability to approach problems analytically and derive actionable insights from complex datasets, while remaining focused on providing value to customers Strategic Thinking: Demonstrated ability to translate data findings into strategic, achievable recommendations to drive business outcomes. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to effectively convey technical concepts from technical to non-technical stakeholders and vice-versa. Team Player: Proven track record of collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment. Adaptability: Have consistently demonstrated the ability to bring structure to complex, unstructured environments. Familiarity with Agile development methodologies. Ability to adapt to changing priorities to thrive in dynamic work environments. Salary and Benefits: Nothing is more important to us than the well-being of our team. That is why we are proud to offer a full suite of competitive health benefits along with additional benefits such as: flexible PTO, a professional development stipend and work from home stipend, volunteer opportunities, and team social activities. Salaries vary and are dependent on considerations such as: experience and specific skills/certifications. The base plus target bonus total compensation range for this role is $95,000 - $125,000. Additional compensation beyond this range is available as a result of leadership and business development opportunities. Salary details are discussed openly during the hiring process. Work Environment: TGG is headquartered in Portland, Oregon, and has team members living in various locations across the United States. Our consultants must have the ability to travel and to work remotely or onsite. Each engagement has unique conditions, and we work collaboratively to meet both our client and team's needs regarding onsite and travel requirements. Why The Gunter Group: TGG was created to be different, to be relational, to be insightful, and to maximize potential for our consultants, our clients, and our community. We listen first so we can learn, analyze, and deliver meaningful solutions for our clients. Our compass points towards our people and our “Non-Negotiables” always. Our driven employees make us who we are — a talented team of leaders with deep and diverse professional experience. If you think this role is the right fit, please submit your resume and cover letter so we can learn more about you. The Gunter Group LLC is an equal opportunity employer.
summary: TGG is seeking a Data Analyst to join their team. This role will involve analyzing large datasets, developing dashboards and reports, collaborating with product managers and engineers, conducting A/B testing, and presenting findings to stakeholders. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in a related field, 0-4 years of relevant experience, strong analysis capabilities, and experience with source control, data extraction, transformation, and storage, cloud platform services, data cleaning and preparation, data visualization, SQL, Python, Excel, Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, Adobe Analytics, and statistical concepts and techniques.

title: Junior Data Analyst
description: WHO WE ARE : At Fors Marsh, we take on issues that matter. We are a team of researchers, advisors, and communicators working together to shape the systems that shape people's lives. We look at human behavior from all angles to design targeted solutions that influence decision-making and move people to action. We are committed to the problem, not just the project, and we are intentional about taking on work and forming partnerships that balance purpose, people, planet, and profit. We are a certified B Corporation, a Just employer, and a 2019–2024 Top Workplace awardee. We hold ourselves accountable to the values that have always defined us, and those values drive us to be the best possible versions of ourselves—for each other, our communities, our clients, and the world. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Fors Marsh is seeking a candidate who will provide full-time support to Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and/or DHS sub-agencies in the areas of project management, program and policy research, and facilitating progress on agency mission and objectives. Specifically, this position will serve as support for performance management and program evaluation for a suite of federal programs focused on translating knowledge into actionable policies and practices. This position is a contingent hire, meaning it is contingent on Fors Marsh winning an upcoming proposal. The interview process will be the same as our standard process, the offer letter (should we decide to move forward) will serve as a letter of commitment. Key Responsibilities: Develop or apply mathematical or statistical theory and methods to collect, organize, interpret, and summarize numerical data to provide usable information. Responsible for the development of analytical solutions and databases. Develop specifications for the most efficient database solutions. Good working knowledge and hands-on experience with key software platform architectures, web servers, application servers, and relational databases. May evaluate new data sources for adherence to the organization's quality standards and ease of integration. Provide consultation on complex projects. Assist in exploring, categorizing and reviewing information. Inspect, clean, transform and model data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting DHS decision-making; ability to mine, review and validate data in order to develop models and data visualization that focus on predictive purposes and developing pertinent business information for DHS decision-makers. Possess the ability to create and manage dashboards. Be able to review database architecture and data control polices and offer recommendations for improvement, and be able to support the existing development of an activity-based costing (ABC) model or development of new ABC models as required. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, social science, public policy or related field required. 1-3 years' experience working with datasets or databases, preferably in a federal working environment. Ability to apply tools like data analytics, data visualization, and performance measurement to help clients answer priority questions. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including, PowerPoint, Excel and Word; Strong quantitative ability and a keen eye for detail and accuracy. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities with minimum direction and supervision. Effective written and oral communication skills. Experience writing syntax in SPSS, or Stata. (Additional programming skill in other languages such as SAS, R or SQL is desired but not required.) Must be a U.S. Citizen and consent to a full background check due to our federal contract requirements. Active security clearance within the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) agency or active Secret/Top Secret Clearance. We Offer: Our benefits typically meet or exceed our competitors’ packages. Ways we are unique? Ability to make an impact on people’s lives, both internal and external to the organization. Top-tier health, dental, vision, and long and short-term disability coverage all covered at 100% for employee coverage. Remote work. Our company culture, which values balance and allows each employee to take leave as they require it to balance the responsibilities of both their work and home lives without worrying about depleting their available leave hours. We provide a floating holiday bank so you can celebrate the days you value. Generous matching retirement contributions and no vesting period starting the third month of employment. Dedicated training and development budgets to expand your expertise and grow your skillset. You can volunteer your way with paid time off. You can participate in Fors Marsh staff-led affinity groups. Our employees receive product and service discounts through the certified B Corp network. Contingent hire position status. Salary: $57,000-$73,00 FM Career Map: Research Analyst II Location: Remote. United States Residents only. EOE: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran
summary: Fors Marsh is seeking a Research Analyst II to support the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in project management, program and policy research, and facilitating progress on agency mission and objectives. The role focuses on performance management and program evaluation for federal programs, translating knowledge into actionable policies and practices.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Join Our Team as a Senior Data Analyst at Nerdery! Are you a strategic thinker with a knack for turning complex data into actionable insights? Nerdery is seeking a highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Strategic Insights and Analytics team. In this pivotal role, you'll harness the power of data to drive informed decisions that enhance marketing, operations, strategy, and business practices. Your expertise in gathering, analyzing, and visualizing data will be instrumental in shaping the future of our clients' businesses. What You'll Do: Understand Client Needs: Dive deep into clients' business problems and questions to grasp the broader context of how data analysis can support their objectives. Stakeholder Communication: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements, ensuring alignment and clarity. Data Governance: Implement best practices to define processes and technologies that manage data assets sustainably. Data Strategy: Develop a robust data strategy that leverages relevant data sources for maximum impact. Data Mining: Extract valuable information from data sets, identifying correlations and patterns to provide actionable insights. Information Organization: Transform raw data into comprehensible structures and frameworks for easy interpretation. Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical methods to analyze data and generate insights. Synthesize Insights: Integrate insights from various data sources, including product, operational, customer, and behavioral data. Data Visualization: Use tools like Power BI, Looker, and Tableau to create clear, easy-to-understand data visualizations. Effective Communication: Present synthesized insights, processes, and strategies to both internal and external stakeholders. What We're Looking For: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Mathematics, Data Analytics, or Computer Science 5+ years of experience in data analysis, governance, strategy, and visualization Proficiency in creating analytics dashboards using Looker, Tableau, and Power BI Strong understanding of product analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, or Quantum Metric Exceptional analytical skills with the ability to organize, interpret data, and develop actionable insights Demonstrated ability to create compelling storylines and recommendations Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills Preferred Qualifications: Master’s degree in Mathematics, Data Analytics, or Computer Science Proven experience with Google visualization and reporting tools like Looker In-depth knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques Proficiency in SQL, SPSS and/or SAS, and Python Why Nerdery? At Nerdery, you'll be part of a dynamic team dedicated to leveraging data to drive meaningful business outcomes. We offer a collaborative work environment where your expertise will be valued, and your contributions will make a tangible impact. Ready to Make an Impact? If you're passionate about data and ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and help us drive the future of data-driven decision-making. Are We the Right Fit For You? The best way to get the scoop on whether Nerdery is the right place for you is to chat with current Nerds. We would be delighted to have a conversation with you and share insight into what it’s really like to work at our organization and if it’s a place where you can thrive. Our interview process will provide you ample opportunity to talk with other team members and assess whether the role is a good fit for your next chapter. Take the first step and apply today – our Talent Advocates will then reach out to you to get the ball rolling! Must be legally authorized to work within the country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status. Nerdery is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state and local fair employment practice laws. Nerdery strictly prohibits and does not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants or any other covered persons because of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation, gender (including gender nonconformity and status as a transgender or transsexual individual), pregnancy, marital status, familial status, age, physical or mental disability, citizenship, past, current or prospective service in the uniformed services, genetic information, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state or local law. All employees, other workers and representatives of Nerdery are prohibited from engaging in unlawful discrimination. Nerdery will ensure that all employment practices are free of such discrimination. Such employment practices include, but are not limited to: hiring, promotion, demotion, transfer, recruitment or recruitment advertising, selection, layoff, disciplinary action, termination, compensation, benefits, selection for training, including apprenticeship and other terms and conditions of employment. Nerdery will also provide reasonable accommodation to applicants and employees with disabilities pursuant to all applicable laws.
summary: Nerdery seeks a Senior Data Analyst to join their Strategic Insights and Analytics team. This role involves understanding client needs, data governance, strategy development, data mining, statistical analysis, and visualization using tools like Power BI, Looker, and Tableau. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree in a related field, 5+ years of experience in data analysis, and proficiency with Looker, Tableau, and Power BI.  They should also be skilled in Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, or Quantum Metric, and have exceptional analytical skills with the ability to create compelling storylines and recommendations.  Preferred qualifications include a Master's degree, experience with Google visualization tools, and proficiency in SQL, SPSS, SAS, and Python.

title: Supply Chain Data & Analytics Analyst
description: Position Summary As a temporary Analyst of the Supply Chain Data & Analytics teams at company, you will be responsible to run analyses and reports with large and diverse data sets, which will be used to influence leaders, improve Supply Chain efficiency, decrease Supply Chain spend, and improve customer satisfaction. You will support data analyses needed by the clients Supply Chain organization, including Customer Excellence, Demand & Supply Planning, Logistics, Procurement, and Supply Chain Strategy. You will report to the Senior Manager, Supply Chain Data & Analytics, with oversight by Senior Analysts in the team. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Analytics Execute long-term Supply Chain analyses and reports in a timely manner with high quality and minimal oversight. Participate in analyses related discussions to capture discussion takeaways and make corresponding updates to the analyses. As needed, support Senior Analysts to enhance existing Supply Chain analyses and reports based on provided direction. As needed, support Senior Analysts in strategic short-term analysis requests with data extraction from Oracle Business Intelligence (OBIEE) and data cleaning based on provided direction. Knowledge & Skills Fast learner - ability to quickly get up to speed and take over ownership of assigned analyses and reports. Strong analytical skills – ability to generate assigned analyses and reports in a timely manner and with high quality. Attention to details. Excellent verbal and interpersonal communication. Ability to build relationships and work collaboratively with others in the team to meet shared objectives. Understanding of overall supply chain flow, process, and metrics is preferred. Self-motivated & Proactive. Flexibility and change-minded Minimum Qualifications, Education & Experience Must be at least 18 years of age. Bachelor's degree required. Degree with specialization in statistics, computer science, data science, or another technical/quantitative field preferred. Analytical work experience with experience in extrapolating large data sets Supply Chain experience, with a strong understanding of key Supply Chain and challenges is preferred. Proficient with MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint and capable of executing visually compelling presentations of data models / results.
summary: As a temporary Analyst in the Supply Chain Data & Analytics team, you will execute long-term analyses and reports using large datasets, influencing leaders, improving efficiency, reducing spending, and enhancing customer satisfaction. You will collaborate with various Supply Chain departments and report to the Senior Manager, with oversight from Senior Analysts.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Sr. Analyst Excellent opportunity to capitalize on your career with a well established company and industry leaders. You will be joining a team working on multiple initiatives, including working on our eCommerce platform.
