summary: Data Analyst with 3+ years of experience in SQL, technical analysis, and story writing.  Will work with data engineers to synthesize business requirements, develop technical requirements, document data scenarios, and validate solutions.  Experience with healthcare data, Transactional and Data Lake data stores, and Databricks preferred.

title: Data Analyst - Data Research Team
description: Founded in 2018, with employees across the world, The Block is the leading research, analysis, and news brand in the digital asset space. The Block's team is spread across 5 continents and 15+ time zones, covering the global cryptocurrency space 24/7. At The Block, we see digital assets as a ubiquitous part of the future. As this space continues to evolve, we view our role as the trusted moderator and authoritative voice for those who invest in, work with, make decisions about, or seek to understand digital assets. The Block Research is looking for a passionate individual to join our 25-person research team. As a data analyst on our Research team, you will help us create infrastructure for our existing and future data products, as well as automate insights search that our team uses on a daily basis. You will work directly with the Research Lead of Data, Simon Cousaert, and the existing data team. In addition, you will further refine your already substantial knowledge about the digital assets landscape. By leveraging our strong industry network and wide reach within the digital assets community, you will be able to build your own personal brand in the relevant tech circles. Having access to our expertise and state-of-the-art blockchain APIs, you will be able to use your technical skills to create a scalable infrastructure that is in high demand by blockchain projects and crypto funds globally. This role offers competitive compensation and significant opportunities for advancement. Job Duties / Responsibilities: Build parsers for various social media and other sources of alternative data Index blockchains and write SQL/GraphQL queries Work with our engineering team to build scalable data infrastructure Support the editorial and research team in complex data pulls Prepare data for adding new features to The Block’s Data Dashboard Successful candidates must have: Experience with digital assets, crypto, and blockchain technologies SQL knowledge and experience with GraphQL Skills of data scraping and interaction with internal API of websites Experience with databases and AWS or GCP data solutions Experience with ETL data pipelines The ability to find a solution to even the most difficult issues and dig deep Successful candidates will likely have: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, and understanding of EVM and smart contracts Experience in Business Intelligence products such as Google Data Studio Experience in building stable connectors using REST and WebSocket API Familiarity with Unix/Linux operating systems, general command-line knowledge, and source control software About The Block: Who We Are: The culture of The Block lies in our key behaviors. It’s who we are and it’s how we show up everyday. We are confidently humble. We jump in and roll up our sleeves. We know there’s always more to learn and we operate without egos. We are actionably curious. We strive to be an expert in our field and always seek opportunities to expand our knowledge and skill set. We put our learnings into practice every day. We practice tenacious ownership. Every day when we show up we are contributors, teammates, and owners. We rotate through those three hats with agility and without sacrificing accountability or consistency. We practice respectful partnership. We treat others as we’d expect to be treated - with respect, concern, understanding, and patience. Why You Should Work Here: We take care of our employees and we have the benefits and perks to support it. Our full-time, US based employees are eligible for Unlimited PTO, remote first environment, high health plan employer contributions, monthly wellness stipend, generous parental leave policy, 401k match, fitness partnerships, fertility benefits, One Medical membership and citibike membership. We’re a remote first company which allows us to hire the best person for the job regardless of location. Impactful work. Regardless of your role at The Block you’re making a meaningful contribution to our mission in accelerating the evolution of financial systems through independent reporting and technical research of all projects influencing the future of financial services. What Else Should You Know? The Block is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. During our application process we collect completely anonymous diversity information. Providing this information is voluntary but we want you to know what we do with it. We use the data to ensure that our recruiting practices are bringing diverse talent to the organization and we are reacting where we are coming up short. We strive to use the data to ensure we have the tools and resources for all employees both during the interview process and should those employees choose to join us at The Block.
summary: The Block Research is looking for a Data Analyst to join their 25-person team. You will create data infrastructure, automate insights search, and work with the research lead and data team. This role offers competitive compensation and advancement opportunities. Responsibilities include building parsers for social media data, indexing blockchains, writing SQL/GraphQL queries, building data infrastructure with the engineering team, supporting the editorial and research team, and preparing data for new features on The Block's Data Dashboard.

title: Data Analyst/Curator
description: At Liaison, we’ve helped higher education institutions build better, more diverse classes for three decades. You may recognize us as the company behind the Centralized Application Service (CAS), Enrollment Marketing services and platform (EMP), SlideRoom, Time2Track, TargetX (CRM) and Othot. Everything we do is focused on taking that proven success and expanding its scope and scale. Over 31,000 programs on more than 1,000 campuses see us as a forward-thinking partner integral to meeting their total enrollment goals — and we’re building the data- and mission-driven team that will reinforce our role for decades to come . The Data Curator works closely with others on the team, as well as our customers, to help democratize machine learning. This role works on challenging projects to develop new features on our platform and strengthens our infrastructur Responsibilities: Build, validate, and troubleshoot predictive data science models in collaboration with the Data Science team using internal tools and metrics Perform stringent data checks to identify and address inconsistent data issues and leak variables Tailor customer models and data processing pipelines to each individual institution’s needs, processes, and goals Contribute creative feature engineering solutions for use in customer models Build out necessary configuration files to deploy customer models Communicate data specifications and data issues to other team members and our customers Collaborate in designing and improving the functionalities of internal tools and products Automate or help automate as many manual data analysis activities as possible Position Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in math, computer science, business administration and information systems or another relevant field required Background or familiarity with statistics and business analytics Capacity to work independently and/or as part of a team Preferred Attributes: Computer programming skills, specifically SQL and Python Advanced degree
summary: Liaison is seeking a Data Curator to help democratize machine learning. The role involves building and validating predictive data science models, performing data checks, tailoring customer models, contributing to feature engineering, building configuration files, communicating data specifications, collaborating on tool improvements, and automating data analysis activities. This position requires a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, background in statistics and business analytics, and strong independent and team work skills.

title: Data Analyst, Operations Business Analytics
description: Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more. Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “HIMS”. To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com , or visit our investor site . For information on the company’s outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals . About The Role We are seeking a highly motivated, detail-oriented Data Analyst to help support business-critical planning and operational metrics. You will leverage your problem-solving abilities, motivation, and exceptional attention to gather data, forecasts and insights to help build an operational plan that supports labor and capacity planning. This role requires both technical aptitude and business acumen. This analyst will partner with various business teams including Operations, Planning, Supply Chain, and Finance. You Will Facilitate weekly S&OP meeting by gathering insights/metrics from the Operations planning and fulfillment teams Support continuous improvement by building new metrics and reporting to support Operations planning Work with Production planning and material planning to manage order routing decisions across the network Continue to build out inputs that support growing operational needs Run ad-hoc analyses and special initiatives, working with large data sets to assess business performance and inform business decisions Help build, maintain, and report on complex data models Work with cross-functional teams to identify new reporting and data requirements, document requirements, build reports and coordinate with engineering to provide the necessary data points Investigate anomalies in reporting data, and assist in any clean up or communication required as a result You Have: 3+ years of in-depth Business Intelligence in Operations or Supply Chain Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field Proficiency with SQL Experience with data visualization software (Looker/Tableau a huge plus) Hands on experience working with a modern analytics tech stack (Looker, Google, Big Query, DBT, Python, R, etc Expert Excel proficiency including experience with data manipulations – Lookups, PivotTables, External Data Connections, basic experience in retool Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to effectively communicate in a clear and concise manner Ability to think through complex problems, determine proper analytical processes and procedures, independently derive conclusions and present results to the team Detail-oriented and exceptionally organized Able to multi-task, prioritize, and manage multiple projects in a fast-paced ambiguous environment Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights): Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP) Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products 401k benefits with employer matching contribution Offsite team retreats Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H’s compensation range for this role for US-based candidates . If you're based outside of the US, your recruiter will be able to provide you with an estimated salary range for your location. The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location. H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that may include an equity grant. Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on location and job-related factors. An estimate of the current salary range for US-based employees is $105,000 — $115,000 USD We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. Hims is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Hims considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Hims & hers is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@forhims.com . Please do not send resumes to this email address. For our California-based applicants – Please see our California Employment Candidate Privacy Policy to learn more about how we collect, use, retain, and disclose Personal Information.
summary: Hims & Hers is seeking a Data Analyst to support business-critical planning and operational metrics. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency with SQL, data visualization software, and a modern analytics tech stack. Responsibilities include facilitating S&OP meetings, building metrics and reporting, managing order routing decisions, running ad-hoc analyses, and working with cross-functional teams to identify new reporting and data requirements.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data Analyst Location: Atlanta, GA (100% onsite Needed, Need Locals) Job Summary The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. This role requires a strong analytical mindset, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate findings effectively. Knowledge of tools like Alteryx, Power BI, and QlikView is essential. Key Responsibilities Supply chain experience and extra ordinary communication is Plus. Data Analysis: Collect, organize, and interpret large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Dashboard Development: Develop and maintain data dashboards, reports, and visualizations using Power BI, QlikView, and other tools to track KPIs and metrics. Ad-Hoc Analysis: Conduct ad-hoc analysis to support various business functions and projects. Cross-functional collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver insights that drive strategic decisions. Data Integrity: Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing data quality checks and cleaning. Statistical Analysis: Utilize statistical techniques and software to analyze data and generate actionable recommendations. Industry Trends: Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization. Requirements: Educational Background: Master's degree in Data Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Technical Proficiency: Proven experience as a Data Analyst with proficiency in Alteryx, Power BI, QlikView, SQL queries, and Python. Soft Skills & Experience: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, excellent communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, ability to work effectively in a team, supply chain experience (a plus), and knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes.
summary: The Data Analyst will collect, process, and analyze data to provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making. This role requires strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and effective communication. Knowledge of tools like Alteryx, Power BI, and QlikView is essential.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Immediate need for a talented Senior Data Analyst. This is a 12 +months contract opportunity with long-term potential and is located in Charlotte, NC (Hybrid). Please review the job description below and contact me ASAP if you are interested. Job ID: 24-30195 Pay Range: $60 - $65/hour. Employee benefits include, but are not limited to, health insurance (medical, dental, vision), 401(k) plan, and paid sick leave (depending on work location). Key Responsibilities: Seeking data-driven professionals to support audit delivery teams. Responsibilities include extracting information, conducting testing to validate risk and controls, and providing data-driven insights to the audit process. Proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools Helping audit teams conduct testing to validate risk and controls Understanding of audit processes and risk management Collaborate closely with audit teams to understand their requirements and provide analytical support Assist in designing and executing tests to evaluate the effectiveness of risk management strategies and internal controls. Prepare clear and concise reports summarizing findings and recommendations based on data analysis. Key Requirements and Technology Experience: Top Skills: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, SAS etc. Experience in banking industry Experience/knowledge of audit process and various types of risks associated with banking industry Certification in Data Analytics or relevant technologies (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Excel). Our client is a leading Financial Industry, and we are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. If you are interested in this position, please apply online for immediate consideration. Pyramid Consulting, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
summary: A 12+ month contract opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to support audit delivery teams in the financial industry. Responsibilities include data extraction, risk and control testing, and providing data-driven insights. The ideal candidate will have strong proficiency in data analysis, reporting, and visualization tools, as well as experience in the banking industry and knowledge of audit processes and risks.

title: Data Analyst
description: Description SFI seeks a data analyst to engage in data collection, analysis and reporting to support our customer data management practices. The data analyst will utilize a multitude of methodological approaches to manage and execute a range of data entry, data quality, and research activities. The position requires a highly motivated and collaborative individual who has a data analysis background and possesses strong organizational, analytic, and writing abilities. Requirements Bachelor’s degree required; preferred in statistics or math related field. 2 years of data entry/analysis experience preferred Excellent communication skills, including the ability to simplify complex concepts in writing, visualizations, and verbal presentations tailored for diverse groups of stakeholders Attention to detail. Responsibilities/Job Description Data Support Data enters and manages all received information into the appropriate system in an accurate, consistent, and timely manner. Coordinate, communicate, and follow up on any issues with the appropriate supervisor or customer to ensure complete accuracy. Communicate with relevant stakeholders regarding invalid or late data / Organize and file submissions in repositories. Analytical – Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data analyses. Be proficient (able to create/modify) with tools that support data analyses – SQL Server, PowerBi, Excel, or similar tools. Work with a team of developers to support the USAID DIS application which is a data intensive application, and helpdesk/IT support in a SAFe 6 scaled agile development environment. Perform other duties and/or projects as assigned. Additional Information In order to meet the clearance requirements for this opportunity, candidates must be authorized to work in the US. All candidates will be subject to a complete background check to include, but not limited to Criminal History, Education Verification, Professional Certification Verification, Verification of Previous Employment and Credit History. The salary for this position is $50,000 - $100,000 annually For information on SFI's benefits please visit http://www.spatialfront.com/pages/career.html This is a full-time W2 position. Please no agencies, third parties, or corp-to-corp. Spatial Front Inc. is an Equal-opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Spatial Front Inc. participates in E-Verify. Salary Description $50,000k - $100,000k
summary: SFI is seeking a data analyst to manage and execute data entry, data quality, and research activities. The role requires strong organizational, analytic, and communication skills, and proficiency with data analysis tools like SQL Server, PowerBi, and Excel. The candidate will work with a team of developers in a SAFe 6 scaled agile development environment to support the USAID DIS application.

title: Metric & Data Analyst - Arlington, TX
description: Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) is looking to hire a Metric & Data Analyst to support our Arlington, TX site. The selected candidate will be an extension of an advanced data analytics team consisting of colleagues possessing varying skill sets including data scientists, data engineers, front-end and back-end developers, and other data analysts. Our Ideal Candidate Is Someone Who Can Create interactive data analytics dashboards to measure and improve operations performance Collect, analyze, and summarize data to communicate insightful information to key stakeholders Work closely with leadership team, IT team, and other key stakeholders Present thorough and detailed reports to identify areas of opportunity to drive future decision making Perform data validation and maintain integrity of dashboards and databases Maintain and optimize current Tableau dashboards Develop and automate data pipelines Complete Ad-hoc research request from senior leadership
summary: Lockheed Martin MFC seeks a Metric & Data Analyst to join their advanced data analytics team in Arlington, TX.  This role involves creating interactive dashboards, analyzing data to inform stakeholders, presenting reports, validating data, maintaining Tableau dashboards, developing data pipelines, and completing ad-hoc research requests.

title: Data and Insight Analyst - AI
description: Overview Cotiviti is currently looking to add an industry leading Data & Insight Analyst who is focused on architecting and developing best-in-class and innovative analytics, reporting, and support our AI/ML Center of Excellences. This role will have responsibility for establishing and sustaining processes and practices that support Big Data, Analytics, and Reporting solutions and applications. The Data & Insight Analyst should have a passion for data, working with business people, creating solutions, and developing causal relationships that fuel a data-driven culture. This role will spend time working independently and as part of a team and will focus on specific deadlines in an Agile development process as defined by the management team. Responsibilities Architect and hands-on development of Analytics, Statistical Analysis, and Reporting solutions. Implementing and configuring reporting technologies like Tableau, SuperSet, and Viola. Proficient with SQL for databases like Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MySQL. Proficient with Python language and Spark framework. Architect, design, build and integrate solutions using Hadoop, OpenShift, and cloud vendors. Redesigning existing reports and information collection processes for enhanced utility and usability. Managing the day-to-day activities of the AI/ML Center of Excellence that’s tasked “making better decisions with data science” in Hadoop, Openshift, and cloud environments. Drive automation capabilities into Analytics, Statistical Analysis, and Reporting solutions. Drive development of causal relationships for business metrics and drivers. Establish credibility and strong working relationship with development teams to review design and code for adherence to established standards and best practices. Deliver using an Agile development process. Maintain our repository and other relevant documentation. Consulting skills strong enough to work with clients on their reporting needs. Understands claims data, how data is stored in analytical platforms, and how to use and apply claims data in the validation of payment accuracy concepts and other projects. Knowledge and ability to use Statistical methodology to solve business problems. Ability to understand, generate, and evaluate healthcare utilization, unit cost, and medical cost trends. This includes understanding levers that affect healthcare cost, such as contracting, networks, policies, benefit structures, and product design. Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on financial data. Ability to actively and skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action. Ability to appropriately summarize and effectively communicate complex concepts & varied datasets to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt action for multiple audiences ranging from the analyst to executive level using oral, written, and presentations. Attention to detail and accuracy. Desire and capacity to learn new concepts and software. Strong analytical and problem-solving ability. Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information. Qualifications Big Data Analysis: Strong ability to manage and analyze data in a Big Data environment using a variety of scripts, potentially including but not limited to Scala/Spark and Python as well as Cloud based Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning capabilities. Reasoning and Problem Solving: Ability to actively and skillfully conceptualize, apply, analyze, synthesize, and/or evaluate information gathered from, or generated by, observation, experience, reflection, reasoning, or communication, as a guide to belief and action. Consulting: Demonstrated ability to make and gain acceptance of data-driven recommendations made to business owners. Strong ability to appropriately summarize and effectively communicate complex concepts & varied data sets to inform stakeholders, gain approval, or prompt actions; Applies to multiple audiences ranging from the analyst to executive level; Includes oral & written communication and multimedia presentation. Statistical Analysis: Apply statistical methodology to solve business problems; appropriately interprets meaning from results. Business Knowledge: Good understanding of the tenets of health insurance, the managed care model, industry coding/policy standards, the claim adjudication process, and issues related to fraud waste and abuse. Ability to apply this knowledge to the development & evaluation of new initiatives and support leading the team strategy toward best practices. Financial Analysis: Ability to understand, generate and evaluate healthcare utilization, unit cost and medical cost trends. This includes understanding levers that affect healthcare cost, such as contracting, networks, policies, benefit structures, and product design. Ability to draw conclusions and make recommendations based on financial data. Functional Programming: Ability to work with, understand and create object oriented/functional programming solutions using modern application frameworks. Minimum Qualifications MS Degree in relevant discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Health Sciences) or a Bachelor’s degree in relevant discipline with at least 5 years of relevant experience. 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in advanced analytics. 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in working in Big Data environments, specifically Hadoop and cloud vendors 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) in business intelligence. 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) with SQL, ability to write SQL queries to efficiently extract data from SQL Server/Oracle and Hive/Impala. 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) using Scala, Python, or R programming languages. 2+ years of experience (or recent Masters+ graduate) using distributed frameworks, such as Spark. Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as a team. Flexibility to work with global teams as well geographically dispersed US based teams. Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information. Be value-driven, understand that success is based on the impact of your work rather than its complexity or the level of effort. Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet deadlines. Ability to work within a matrixed organization. Proficiency in all required skills and competencies above. Additional Beneficial Requirements Knowledge or experience of DevOps lifecycle tools like GitHub/Gitlab/BitBucket, Jenkins, Jira. Experience or knowledge of the health insurance industry in the U.S. Mental Requirements Communicating with others to exchange information. Assessing the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned. Physical Requirements And Working Conditions Remaining in a stationary position, often standing or sitting for prolonged periods. Repeating motions that may include the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Must be able to provide a dedicated, secure work area. Must be able to provide high-speed internet access/connectivity and office setup and maintenance. No adverse environmental conditions expected. Base compensation ranges from $72,000 to $96,000. Specific offers are determined by various factors, such as experience, education, skills, certifications, and other business needs. Cotiviti offers team members a competitive benefits package to address a wide range of personal and family needs, including medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance coverage, 401(k) savings plans, paid family leave, 9 paid holidays per year, and 17-27 days of Paid Time Off (PTO) per year, depending on specific level and length of service with Cotiviti. For information about our benefits package, please refer to our Careers page. Date of posting: 5/17/2024 Applications are assessed on a rolling basis. We anticipate that the application window will close on 7/7/2024, but the application window may change depending on the volume of applications received or close immediately if a qualified candidate is selected.
summary: Cotiviti seeks a Data & Insight Analyst to architect and develop analytics, reporting, and support for its AI/ML Center of Excellence. This role involves Big Data, Analytics, and Reporting solutions, requiring strong skills in SQL, Python, Spark, Hadoop, OpenShift, Tableau, SuperSet, and Viola. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and problem-solving skills, be adept at communication, and have a good understanding of healthcare insurance and financial analysis. Experience in Big Data environments, business intelligence, and relevant programming languages is essential.

title: Data Analyst

The ideal candidate will have experience with data analytics software and methodologies, including ACL, Excel, Monarch, MS Access, SAS, and Geo Mapping. title: Data Analyst
description: Apex Systems is seeking a Data Analyst for one of our large Financial clients. This role will be a 12-month contract and sit onsite 3 days/week in Charlotte, NC. If interested, please apply directly to the posting. Job Title : Data Analyst Client : Can disclose over the phone Location : Charlotte, NC - hybrid schedule Duration : 12-month contract Rate : $60-68/hr (contingent on experience) Required Experience: Bachelor's degree in information technology, information systems, computer science or business-related field, six years of experience in a role of data analysis, statistical analysis, data transformation, data reconciliation and/or sophisticated data presentation or equivalent education and related training or experience Experience in ETL Development using standard tools Understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse concepts and prior experience applying that understanding to query data in a Very Large Database (VLDB) environment Familiarity with using a query analysis tool. title: Frac Data Analyst
description: About Corva Corva has built a first-of-its-kind energy app store on a bedrock of best-in-class technologies, data pipelines, and a secure and scalable architecture. Our energy solutions solve today's toughest well delivery challenges, from well design through drillout. The ever-evolving platform is not only future-proof for digitizing operations but is your toolkit to accelerate sustainability and energy transition goals. Our platform is built for speed and reliability and delivers unmatched features and capabilities. We are powering worldwide innovation by driving efficiency, productivity, and profitability with our innovative energy solutions. Mission Corva’s mission is to accelerate the future of energy. Values Boldness : Corvanauts have the confidence and courage to question status quo for the products we make and the relationships we cultivate. Own End-to-End : We take ownership of what we start and see it through to completion through trust and dependability. Transparency : It's crucial to be open and honest and consistent with updates and data flow with customers and colleagues. We value the free-flowing of information and data to make better decisions. Bias Action : Corvanauts don't sit still - our default mode is taking action! We make progress through high-quality iterations. Failure is built into the process and success is defined by the number of shots on goal. About the role We are seeking Completions Analysts located in Houston to provide part of the 24/7 operational support for the Corva system. The Analyst ensures that each well on Corva is ready for our customers to make real-time completions decisions has a laser focus on accuracy and timeliness. The Analyst supports customers via phone and email support and proactively QCs all data and visuals on Corva. What you'll do Enter data of various types into the web-based system in a timely manner Identify various types of data quality issues through regular QAQC checks and follow procedures to correct issues Communicate with customers to resolve issues as needed Build customer dashboards and support customers building their own dashboards Ability to work remotely as needed Review data and trends to ensure accuracy and completeness Ensure all work is prioritized and completed correctly Identify anomalies and problematic data Follow communication protocols for various customers to resolve issues Prepare written reports daily regarding operations and QAQC status Ensure proper operation of the web-based system through continuous checks Provide testing of staged systems prior to deployment onto production Identify and communicate opportunities to improve efficiencies in operations Develop operational procedures as needed Other duties as required Qualifications Knowledge of completions systems data, including interpretation of frac and wireline data Ability to work nights and weekends in a rotation (Schedule is 7 days on/7 days off, 12 hour shifts, alternate nights/days) Ability to enter accurate data and prioritize workload Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work well with teams Thorough knowledge of navigating modern web sites Analytical thinking skills Ability to identify anomalies and problem data Ability to train others and collaborate with others in a positive and effective manner Field/RTO experience
summary: Corva is seeking Completions Analysts to provide 24/7 operational support for their energy app store platform. The Analyst will ensure data accuracy and timeliness for customer well completions decisions, provide customer support, and perform quality control checks.

title: Data Analyst (Data Governance)
description: Must Have -- Strong understanding of the Data Governance Concepts -- Strong understanding of the Data Governance Frameworks -- Strong understanding of the end to end Data governance maturity and implementation process -- Familiar with the cloud Services (e.g. AWS, Azure ) -- Configuration of the governance tool -- Governance tool Monitoring and Management -- Configuration of Data Sources and Metadata Pull -- Automation of data element discovery and tagging (PII/Non PII etc) -- Data classification techniques -- Data Sets Creation , Management And Shopping -- Creating users and Roles in governance tool Good to Have -- Integration with the Single Sign On Servers -- Workflow customizations using Activiti Plugin for Eclipse -- Experience in writing Java Programs, Calling APIs , etc
summary: Data Governance Specialist responsible for implementing and managing data governance frameworks, tools, and processes. This role requires a strong understanding of data governance concepts and frameworks, experience with cloud services like AWS and Azure, and proficiency in data governance tools. Responsibilities include tool configuration, monitoring, data source integration, data classification, automation, and user management. Experience with workflow customizations, Java programming, and API integration is a plus.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description Fabletics is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Marketing Science & Analytics team. Fabletics is the operating system behind some of the fastest growing e-commerce brands in history: Fabletics, YITTY, Savage X Fenty, JustFab, ShoeDazzle and FabKids. As an organization driven by data, we're on a mission to optimize marketing spend efficiently and constantly enhance the customer experience across our portfolio of brands. How do you fit in? As a Data Analyst at Fabletics, you will play a crucial role in generating insights that empower our internal teams to scale marketing spend effectively and drive exceptional customer experiences from ad exposure to checkout. You will collaborate closely with Data Analytics, Media, and a diverse team of data professionals with various expertise and focuses. Tools And Technologies Expect to leverage SQL and data visualization tools like Tableau daily, with opportunities to work on larger projects involving data integration and automation using platforms like Databricks and Airflow. Flexibility in choosing the best tools for your role is encouraged, reflecting our commitment to ongoing education and exploration of new technologies. Ideal Candidate We seek a detail-oriented, intrinsically motivated Data Analyst who possesses an inherent curiosity and technical prowess. Your journey to becoming an expert in our systems, tools, and data likely extends beyond formal education, enriched by your passion for diving deep into data analysis. A great storyteller who enjoys collaboration, you will be pivotal in optimizing our digital marketing strategies and media initiatives. This position will report to the Director of Marketing Science & Analytics . What You Will Do Media Attribution Expertise: Implement, maintain, and enhance our internal attribution models using SQL and Python. Testing & Optimization: Create testing frameworks and tagging recommendations to support robust analysis. Design, deploy, and measure lift tests to enhance performance KPIs. Data Extraction & Analysis: Utilize data from various sources (HEAP / Google Analytics, Meta Reporting Suite, Tableau, etc.) to extract insights. Campaign Performance Monitoring: Analyze campaign performance daily, ensuring alignment with business and marketing objectives. Trend Analysis: Uncover trends in large data sets to identify optimization opportunities. Micro-Level Insights: Analyze audience segments, creative themes, ad formats, placements, and bid strategies to improve paid media performance. Campaign Data Management: Consolidate and manage data from diverse marketing platforms. Reporting & Dashboard Maintenance: Generate and maintain reports and dashboards for various media channels and tactics. Decision Support: Provide data-driven recommendations to media leadership and business owners. Executive Presentations: Develop and present complex analytical findings to executive teams. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with Business Intelligence and technical teams to improve data accuracy and architecture. Positive Partnerships: Foster constructive relationships with marketing and business stakeholders. What You Can Bring Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in mathematics, statistics, business analytics, or a related field / equivalent work experience Professional Experience: 2+ years in data analytics. Experience in performance e-commerce, fashion / retail, or advertising agency is a plus. Digital Marketing Analytics: Strong knowledge of digital advertising and analytics platforms (e.g., Meta, TikTok, Google Ads, SA360 Search, etc.). Analytical Tools Proficiency: Experienced in using Microsoft Excel, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Domo, or other BI tools. Technical Skills: Proficient in SQL and comfortable querying large databases. Basic Python skills are advantageous. Problem-Solving Ability: Capable of structuring ambiguous problems and deriving insights from a complex media portfolio. Communication Skills: Clear communicator, able to convey quantitative subjects to technical and non-technical audiences, including executives. Prioritization & Project Management: Excellent at managing multiple tasks and balancing competing priorities under tight deadlines. Learning & Development: Eager to develop new analytical skills in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Curiosity & Passion: Insatiable curiosity and a passion for uncovering truths in data. Compensation & Total Rewards At Fabletics, we believe work and life should fit together! We continue to build a culture of flexibility, to empower you to do your best and put yourself first. Our Total Rewards program rewards employees for their hard work, supporting their health, well-being, families, and ultimately their life journey. Total Rewards at Fabletics includes: Hybrid Work Schedule* Discretionary Paid Time Off* Summer Fridays* Healthcare Plans Employee Discounts 401k Annual Bonus Program Equity Program* And More Varied for retail and fulfillment roles The annual base salary range for this position is from $75,000-$100,000 . The range provided includes the base salary that Fabletics expects to pay for the role. Offered base salary will be dependent on factors including the scope and complexity of the role, candidate’s related work experience, subject matter expertise and work location. About TechStyleOS TechStyleOS is the globally integrated Operations and Services provider behind some of the fastest growing online fashion brands in history, including Fabletics, Savage X Fenty, JustFab, ShoeDazzle, and FabKids. With capabilities spanning technology, data science, supply chain management, fulfillment, customer service, and more, we help brands launch, scale and grow—across product categories and geographically. From predictive analytics to data-driven marketing and attribution, our unique approach is powered by our proprietary, end-to-end tech platform that enables the brands we serve to deliver a level of personalization, value, and satisfaction that are unrivaled in the fashion industry. Fabletics, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, compensate, develop, and promote regardless of race, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable. At Fabletics, Inc., we champion a vibrant workplace culture that thrives on diversity law and do not tolerate discrimination or harassment. We are one team from many backgrounds, innovating through diversity of individuals, who are driven by passion for creating an inclusive space for all. Fabletics, Inc. will continue to champion a workplace culture that prizes diversity and inclusivity. We encourage you to apply regardless of meeting all qualifications and/or requirements.
summary: Fabletics, a fast-growing e-commerce brand, is looking for a Data Analyst to join their Marketing Science & Analytics team. The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience in data analytics, strong knowledge of digital advertising and analytics platforms, and proficiency in SQL.  This role will involve implementing attribution models, designing and deploying A/B tests, analyzing campaign performance, and providing data-driven recommendations to media leadership.

title: Business Data Analyst 2
description: Seeking to add a highly motivated and team-oriented Business Data Analyst to our Global Financial Services team in the pursuit of operational excellence while serving our global commercial sales organization. The ideal candidate will have experience in contract compliance, reporting capabilities and commercial agreements in a fast-paced, growth-oriented company. Responsibilities: Performs detailed reviews of contracts and terms and conditions against Sales Operations checklist of acceptable elements to identify and mitigate legal risks. Flags incomplete and non-compliant terms and notifies responsible parties of open action items; compares new agreements to existing agreements for consistency and accuracy Manages contract change control process and related correspondence requiring Act as a resource for questions regarding contract process for both internal and external contracts Responds to inquiries and researches and resolves problems related to day-to-day commercial contract administration and associated operational issues Proactively identify areas to increase scalability and efficiency in the company's contracting process, proposing, and implementing new policies and procedures as needed Identify relevant issues of concern, providing strategic solutions to Sales Operations leadership Oversee the development and maintenance of a commercial contracts management database and related projects Develop and maintain compliance related Key Performance Indicator/Metrics (KPIs). Prepare or assist in preparing monthly, quarterly, or annual compliance reports and compliance trending reports. Monitoring pricing issues and notifying the sales representative when pricing is incorrect Monitor Financial Services deals portfolio and perform ad-hoc audit when required Establish world class good practices to Measure Contract Management Performance Requirements: The ideal candidate will have demonstrated the ability to continuously learn new procedures and skill sets. Proven experience drafting, negotiating and finalizing a variety of commercial or legal documents at the highest level. Must have excellent organizational skills and the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with changing priorities. Ability to multi-task and handle multiple contract negotiations simultaneously. Mastery of the contract process including contract evaluation, negotiation, approval, tracking and close-out. Ability to mentor others and serve as a Contracts authority to outside departments. Must be able to work independently and exercise judgment. Must have exacting attention to detail, and proficient in MS Office. Education: Either a business-related/legal degree/qualification or equivalent industrial experience 2-5 years of directly applicable experience, preferably in the life sciences field Exceptional written and verbal skills
summary: A Business Data Analyst is needed to ensure contract compliance, reporting capabilities, and commercial agreements in a fast-paced, growing Global Financial Services team. The role involves reviewing contracts, managing change control, resolving issues, identifying areas for improvement, developing databases, and preparing compliance reports. Additionally, it includes monitoring pricing and deal portfolios, implementing best practices, and providing mentorship.

title: IT - Data Analyst II Data Analyst II
description: Summary: Compliance Program Operation – assist in the execution of cybersecurity compliance controls. Position Summary: EIP executes on-going, annual, and quarterly tasks to maintain compliance with SOX, HIPAA, and PCI. This role will be responsible for performing controls and most of these controls have defined procedures that involve extracting data, analyzing it, and validating it to meet compliance requirements. For example: extracting the list of users with administrative access to a specific application or database, analyzing it to ensure it is appropriate, ticketing IT teams to remediate inappropriate access; and extracting configuration data from a system and comparing it to a documented baseline. In both cases, the process needs to be formally documented, validated and entered in our GRC tool (Archer), which is then reviewed by internal and external auditors. Top five skills: MS Office (e.g., Excel, Word) Communication Critical Thinking Data Analysis Experience with Excel and teams is required Compensation: The pay rate range above is the base hourly pay range that Aditi Consulting reasonably expects to pay someone for this position (compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including but not limited to, a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, location and end client requirements). Benefits and Ancillaries: Medical, dental, vision, PTO benefits and ancillaries may be available for eligible Aditi Consulting employees and vary based on the plan options selected by the employee. Aditi Consulting LLC uses AI technology to engage candidates during the sourcing process. AI technology is used to gather data only and does not replace human-based decision making in employment decisions.
summary: This role assists in executing cybersecurity compliance controls related to SOX, HIPAA, and PCI. The responsibilities include extracting, analyzing, and validating data to ensure compliance, documenting processes, and using the GRC tool (Archer) for tracking and review.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: TECHEAD is celebrating over thirty years of incredible heritage, talent, and accomplishments! To learn more about TECHEAD, visit us at TECHEAD.com or on Glassdoor . Senior Data Analyst (Lead) Contract: 6 Months - Could extend or convert Hybrid: 3 days on-site Local Candidate Only Raleigh, NC No C2C Candidates Techead is seeking a highly experienced Data Analyst with a strong focus on Snowflake, data wrangling, process improvement, and data literacy. This is a crucial role optimizing data infrastructure, enhancing data quality, and promoting data-driven decision-making for our client. Responsibilities: - Leverage Snowflake to design, implement, and optimize data models and pipelines - Develop and execute Data Wrangling strategies to clean, transform, and prepare data for analysis - Identify and implement Process Improvements to enhance data quality, accessibility, and governance - Design and build Tableau dashboards and visualizations to drive insights and support decision-making - Promote Data Literacy across the organization through training, workshops, and clear communication - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and develop tailored solutions - Stay current with emerging trends in data technologies, particularly in the Snowflake ecosystem - Contribute to the development of data products and analytics use cases Requirements: - 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on data wrangling and process improvement - Advanced proficiency in Snowflake, including SnowSQL and Snowflake's unique features - Expert-level SQL skills (strong Python programming abilities optional) - Extensive experience with data visualization tools, particularly Tableau - Experience working in Agile environments and collaborating with cross-functional teams (JIRA) - Demonstrated experience in designing and optimizing data pipelines and architectures - In-depth understanding of data governance best practices and implementation strategies - Proven track record of improving data quality and implementing data literacy initiatives - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail - Familiarity with data modeling techniques and best practices - Knowledge of machine learning concepts and their application in data enablement (preferred) - Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical audiences -Requires a proactive, self-motivated individual who can balance technical expertise with strong communication skills to drive data enablement initiatives across the organization. Education: - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field TECHEAD's mission is to make our on-site associates successful by placing them in the right environment so they can grow and prosper. How we treat and respond to our clients and employees is a reflection of who we are and makes us stand out from the rest. Keeping our business focused on building and maintaining relationships with our employees and clients is the key to our success. We won't strive for anything less. TECHEAD provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. For more information on TECHEAD please visit www.techead.com. No second parties will be accepted.
summary: TECHEAD seeks a Senior Data Analyst with strong Snowflake expertise for a 6-month contract (potential extension or conversion) in Raleigh, NC. The role focuses on optimizing data infrastructure, improving data quality, and promoting data-driven decisions for a client. Responsibilities include designing data models, implementing data wrangling strategies, enhancing process improvements, building Tableau dashboards, and fostering data literacy.

title: Data Analyst
description: About You Are you interested in a career that protects the environment and the air we breathe? Are you looking to be a part of a team that is willing to invest in you from day one? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you with our fast-growing ambient air monitoring team. Who are we? We are Montrose, a global environmental services provider offering environmental planning and permitting, measurement and analytical services, and environmental resiliency and sustainability solutions. Our qualified engineers, scientists, technicians, associates, and policy experts are proud of our collective expertise and the collaborative nature of our approach to helping clients. We strive to optimize environmental resiliency in a way that effectively complements our clients’ decision-making and operations and efficiently fulfills their project requirements. We have over 90 offices across the United States, Canada, Europe and Australia and approximately 3,500 employees – all ready to provide solutions for environmental needs. Job Type : Full-time Compensation: $23 - $27 per hour What We Can Offer You As a key member of our Montrose team, you can expect: Mentorship and professional development resources to advance your career Direct exposure to our industry’s leading experts who are solving the world’s toughest environmental challenges An entrepreneurial environment where you can learn, thrive and collaborate with talented colleagues Opportunities to engage and contribute in our Diversity, Fairness and Inclusion and Women Empowering Leadership employee resource groups Competitive compensation package: annual salary ranging from $23 to $27/hour, commensurate with accomplishments, performance, credentials and geography Competitive medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage 401k with a competitive 4% employer match Progressive vacation policies, company holidays and paid parental leave benefits to ensure work/life balance A financial assistance program that supports peers in need, known as the Montrose Foundation Access to a student loan planning tool to optimize your student loan payoff plans and compare student loan rates with lenders. A DAY IN THE LIFE Montrose Air Quality Services, LLC. is affiliated with Montrose Environmental Group, a high-growth Environmental Services company offering a variety of Measurement and Analytical services to a diverse range of clients in industry and government throughout the United States and abroad. Our qualified engineers, scientists, technicians, associates and policy experts are proud of our ability to objectively help industry, the public and regulators work constructively together on environmental opportunities. Our ambient air monitoring group is seeking a Data Analyst / Technical Writer to review data and generate reports as well as other tasks to meet the expectations of our clients by efficiently and profitably generating defensible data on time. Strong organizational skills are a must for this position. The following list of duties are responsibilities of the Data Analyst / Technical Writer: Daily QC-review of raw field data produced by remotely-located, continuous (automated) field air monitoring equipment Note, investigate, and resolve anomalies in data Promptly produce Non-Conformance/Corrective Action (NC/CA) Reports to describe details of any problems identified in data QC-review Track and review NC/CA Reports as they are updated throughout subsequent problem investigation and resolution activities. QA-review field documentation of monitoring system QC and QA performance and systems audit results using spreadsheets and forms. Receive, archive and QA-review laboratory analytical data reports of samples and associated field documentation for sample collection activities. Perform accurate data entry of information from hand written field sheets. Email/communicate questions, comments, changes and work completed with Project Manager and follow up on all pending questions. Process raw monitoring data to identify, document and exclude any invalid data using Excel Macro software, validated field QC check and test results, QA audit results, competed NC/CA Reports and established data validation criteria in accordance with project-specific Monitoring Plan, QAPP and SOPs. Supervise and ensure timely independent QA review of the processed data by designated personnel for final data validation. Write and assemble data reports in accordance with the project-specific Monitoring Plan Perform technical and editorial review of draft and final reports for details, grammar and spelling, calculations, results, and conclusions. Communicate regularly with stakeholders (field staff, labs, clients, regulators, etc.) to ensure data reports conform to project and regulatory agency requirements and are submitted in a timely manner. Promptly communicate to the Project Manager unacceptable test results, recurring or systemic problems with monitoring project activities or operations and work with the Project Manager and other project team members to provide solutions. Archive all paper and electronic QA/QC test documentation, test evaluation results, completed NC/CA Reports, raw data files, data processing files, data reports and related communications with clients and regulatory agencies. Train junior reporting staff on the duties listed above. Contribute improvement ideas to the Project Manager and other project team members and assist in the development of templates, content, and standard procedures for data management, processing, validation and reporting activities. Perform various clerical work where needed (printing, scanning, filing, mailing) Perform other duties as assigned by manager. Create and update SOPs for the group Participate in and lead training for career development, safety and maintaining required certifications Necessary Qualifications To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor’s degree or higher in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Environmental Engineering or a related field. Minimum 2 years of experience with gas chromatography is preferable Experience with understanding and evaluating chromatograms is needed Expertise in organic chemistry is a bonus Advanced ambient testing knowledge preferable Minimum of 2 years of experience in ambient monitoring preferable Excellent organizational, time management, and communication skills Ability to perform example calculations to verify spreadsheet results Punctual and professional when responding to communication Able to interface with cross-functional teams and all levels of personnel/management Strong problem solving and analytical skills Able to work independently, managing multiple responsibilities. This position will often be working on multiple reports at once that are in varying stages of completion Effective verbal and written communication skills Ability to think and act strategically and proactively Strong writing and presentation skills Resourcefulness, flexibility, and resiliency to operate in a dynamic work environment Leads solutions through the use of collaboration, technology and/or innovative strategies Ability and motivation to learn, execute and train on advanced technologies, project or skills Proficient knowledge with Google and Microsoft office Suite products (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) Capability to pass background checks and initial and random drug screening The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact 949-988-3500 or careers@montrose-env.com for assistance. MAKE THE MOVE TO ACCELERATE YOUR CAREER We are going to be blunt – the way we work may not suit everyone. We are a fast-paced, dynamic and high-growth company. You are your own boss, but you will get tons of guidance and plenty of support from talented, super-smart colleagues and its service providers. Therefore, if freedom, autonomy, and head-scratching professional challenges attract you, we could be the perfect match made in heaven. Want to know more about us? Visit montrose-env.com and have fun! Montrose is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Montrose is committed to recruiting and hiring qualified candidates without regard to race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, disability, or veteran status. Montrose is committed to providing access and reasonable accommodation in its employment for individuals with disabilities. #INDMEG
summary: Montrose Environmental Group seeks a Data Analyst/Technical Writer to review ambient air monitoring data, generate reports, and ensure data quality. The role involves data QC, anomaly investigation, report writing, data processing, and training junior staff. Candidates should have a Bachelor's degree in a related field, 2+ years of experience with gas chromatography, strong organizational skills, and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Contract to Hire 100% Remote $80/hr, 120 to 130K base No Sponsorship or C2C Analyst, Data & Analytics Strategy (HPBB) We are seeking an experienced data analytics professional who understands the strategy and tools necessary to enable us to better collect and utilize customer data. The ideal candidate is a customer-obsessed, outcome-oriented visionary who can lead and inspire cross-functional teams to develop and deploy data and analytics solutions that deliver value and efficiency for the business. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the requirements gathering, data strategy and maintenance of key affiliate and loyalty platforms to ensure they’re set up to deliver against our roadmap and value targets, as well as ongoing support & backlog grooming of day-to-day platform data enhancements . This role is heavily cross functional, partnering primarily with our MarTech platform owners and technology teams to successfully translate business requirements into data requirements. Your responsibilities expand across global markets, with the local marketing and analytics teams being your key customer. Being a subject matter expert on our data and analytics stack is going to be critical to ensure you’re able to provide the necessary support and education for the marketing teams. Responsibilities: Drive execution of customer data to support affiliate marketing & loyalty programs, supporting both platform and analytics partners Ensure requirements and platform setup align with the broader vision for how we connect with our leading-edge cross-channel vision for customers Coordinate closely with key stakeholders within Data Analytics, Marketing and Technology, especially the Data Strategy SMEs for Data Application Documents and translates data requirements to deliver and prioritize best in class data practices Lead investigation and abatement of data supply chain issues in support of data quality and accuracy; proactively identify data monitoring and alerting requirements Key Proficiencies include: Deep experience in customer data and analytics products, including loyalty, crm or influencer marketing programs Confident working in a fast-moving environment, with a willingness to make quick decisions based on continuous prioritization and evolving customer needs Good sense of curiosity with genuine desire to learn and think with agility – identifying patterns/trends and applying them in new and unfamiliar situations Robust collaboration skills, with demonstrated experience working cross-functionally Understanding of cultural nuances and previous experience working with people of different cultures and backgrounds Self-starter mindset with a knack for solving complex problems Strong relationship-building skills Requirements: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or equivalent work experience 5 years in customer data and analytics space, ideally in retail 5 years working directly in loyalty or CRM data Working level knowledge of SQL required
summary: We are seeking an experienced data analytics professional to lead and inspire cross-functional teams to develop and deploy data and analytics solutions for affiliate marketing & loyalty programs. This role requires deep experience in customer data and analytics products, strong collaboration skills, and a self-starter mindset.

title: Business Analyst / Data Analyst
description: Genesis10 is currently seeking a Business Analyst / Data Analyst with our client in the financial industry located in Charlotte, NC and Jersey City, NJ. This is a 12 + month contract position. Responsibilities: Focus on building the next generation model development and execution platform including data sourcing Platform will leverage a host of interesting technologies including Spark and Hadoop and utilize a unique, user-configurable, workflow-driven, model execution approach Review technical designs with the development team and ensure it meets the business partner requirements and is a scalable solution to meet longer term strategy Perform data analysis as needed to design data models, data standardizations, data quality/integrity checks, etc. Highlight critical issues / risks across the program and work with partners to identify solutions Key contributor in Agile routines including sprint and capacity planning, prioritizing tasks for monthly releases, back-log maintenance Review initial testing/analysis of implementation/results to ensure the accuracy of implementation Provide support for business partners in required user acceptance testing Identify and manage cross project or functional interdependencies skills Understand business requirements and lead analysis and translation into technical requirements including budgeting and technical documentation Requirements: Familiarity with Python, RDBMS (Oracle, Netezza, SQL Server) knowledge for SQL code development Basic Unix OS skills and Shell scripting; Agile methodology (hands on experience in Epic and Story writing) Analytical skills to perform technical and functional analysis with strong communication Pay Range: $74.51 - $82.51 Only candidates available and ready to work directly as Genesis10 employees will be considered for this position. If you have the described qualifications and are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply! About Genesis10: Ranked a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S. by Staffing Industry Analysts for six consecutive years, Genesis10 puts thousands of consultants and employees to work across the United States every year in contract, contract-for-hire, and permanent placement roles. With more than 300 active clients, Genesis10 provides access to many of the Fortune 100 firms and a variety of mid-market organizations across the full spectrum of industry verticals. For contract roles, Genesis10 offers the benefits listed below. If this is a perm-placement opportunity, our recruiter can talk you through the unique benefits offered for that particular client. Benefits of Working with Genesis10: Access to hundreds of clients, most who have been working with Genesis10 for 5-20+ years. The opportunity to have a career-home in Genesis10; many of our consultants have been working exclusively with Genesis10 for years. Access to an experienced, caring recruiting team (more than 7 years of experience, on average.) Behavioral Health Platform Medical, Dental, Vision Health Savings Account Voluntary Hospital Indemnity (Critical Illness & Accident) Voluntary Term Life Insurance 401K Sick Pay (for applicable states/municipalities) Commuter Benefits (Dallas, NYC, SF) Remote opportunities available For multiple years running, Genesis10 has been recognized as a Top Staffing Firm in the U.S., as a Best Company for Work-Life Balance, as a Best Company for Career Growth, for Diversity, and for Leadership, amongst others. To learn more and to view all our available career opportunities, please visit us at our website. Genesis10 is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

The role involves data analysis, technical design reviews, agile methodologies, and communication with business partners. title: Analytics Analyst - Power BI Developer - Part Time

title: Data Analyst
description: WHO WE ARE : At Fors Marsh, we take on issues that matter. We are a team of researchers, advisors, and communicators working together to shape the systems that shape people's lives. We look at human behavior from all angles to design targeted solutions that influence decision-making and move people to action. We are committed to the problem, not just the project, and we are intentional about taking on work and forming partnerships that balance purpose, people, planet, and profit. We are a certified B Corporation, a Just employer, and a 2019–2024 Top Workplace awardee. We hold ourselves accountable to the values that have always defined us, and those values drive us to be the best possible versions of ourselves—for each other, our communities, our clients, and the world. WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Fors Marsh is seeking a candidate who will provide full-time support to Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and/or DHS sub-agencies in the areas of project management, program and policy research, and facilitating progress on agency mission and objectives. Specifically, this position will serve as the lead for performance management and program evaluation for a suite of federal programs focused on translating knowledge into actionable policies and practices. This position is a contingent hire, meaning it is contingent on Fors Marsh winning an upcoming proposal. The interview process will be the same as our standard process, the offer letter (should we decide to move forward) will serve as a letter of commitment. Key Responsibilities Develop or apply mathematical or statistical theory and methods to collect, organize, interpret, and summarize numerical data to provide usable information. Responsible for the development of analytical solutions and databases. Develop specifications for the most efficient database solutions. Good working knowledge and hands-on experience with key software platform architectures, web servers, application servers, and relational databases. May evaluate new data sources for adherence to the organization's quality standards and ease of integration. Provide consultation on complex projects. Assist in exploring, categorizing and reviewing information. Inspect, clean, transform and model data with the goal of discovering useful information, informing conclusions and supporting DHS decision-making; ability to mine, review and validate data in order to develop models and data visualization that focus on predictive purposes and developing pertinent business information for DHS decision-makers. Possess the ability to create and manage dashboards. Be able to review database architecture and data control polices and offer recommendations for improvement, and be able to support the existing development of an activity-based costing (ABC) model or development of new ABC models as required. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, social science, public policy or related field required. 3-10 years' experience working with datasets or databases, preferably in a federal working environment. Ability to apply tools like data analytics, data visualization, and performance measurement to help clients answer priority questions. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite including, PowerPoint, Excel and Word. Strong quantitative ability and a keen eye for detail and accuracy. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities with minimum direction and supervision. Effective written and oral communication skills. Experience writing syntax in SPSS or Stata. Must be a U.S. Citizen and consent to a full background check due to our federal contract requirements. Active security clearance within the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS) agency or active Secret/Top Secret Clearance. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in statistics, mathematics, social science, public policy or related field. Additional programming skills in languages such as SAS, R, or SQL are desired. We Offer: Our benefits typically meet or exceed our competitors’ packages. Ways we are unique? Ability to make an impact on people’s lives, both internal and external to the organization. Top-tier health, dental, vision, and long and short-term disability coverage all covered at 100% for employee coverage. Remote work. Our company culture, which values balance and allows each employee to take leave as they require it to balance the responsibilities of both their work and home lives without worrying about depleting their available leave hours. We provide a floating holiday bank so you can celebrate the days you value. Generous matching retirement contributions and no vesting period starting the third month of employment. Dedicated training and development budgets to expand your expertise and grow your skillset. You can volunteer your way with paid time off. You can participate in Fors Marsh staff-led affinity groups. Our employees receive product and service discounts through the certified B Corp network. Contingent hire position status. Salary: $76,000-$97,000 FM Career Map: Research Associate II Location: Remote. United States Residents only. EOE: All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran

The candidate will be the lead for performance management and program evaluation for federal programs focused on translating knowledge into actionable policies and practices. This position is contingent on Fors Marsh winning an upcoming proposal.
