title: Data Analyst
description: Join Us in Making a Difference in the Lives of Those Defending Our Nation! Why SURVICE? Come join the SURVICE Engineering mission to protect, enhance, and enable those who defend the United States. Since 1981, we have supported the DoD community, as well as Homeland Security, advanced technologies, environmental, and commercial markets. Our employees have backgrounds in engineering, physics, mathematics, chemistry, computer science, acquisition, technical writing, training, and other technical and administrative fields. And many of our personnel have DoD and/or operational military experience. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a leading organization, come see what we can offer you! Position Data Analyst Location: Dayton, OH Security Clearance: Active Clearance or Eligible to Obtain - U.S. citizenship required Salary: $75,000 - $110,000 Depending on Experience and Education Travel: 5% Benefits: SURVICE Engineering offers a total rewards package to include competitive salaries, comprehensive insurance options, paid time off, 401(k) with company match, flexible spending, tuition reimbursement. Position Summary SURVICE Engineering is currently seeking a Data Analyst to support Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) programs. This position provides analytic support to wargaming as well as platform and AFRL concept research to integrate into wargame design and post-wargame analysis. We are looking for someone who thrives in a small team environment, enjoys asking tough questions, and likes designing and prepping simulative/test environments to help answer these tough questions. Primary Duties And Responsibilities Collaborate with a team of AFRL representatives to research and develop AFRL concepts and analytic requirements for wargame inclusion Provide analytic support to AFRL wargames, to include data management, post-event analysis, and analytic report development Draft analytic reports exploring historical trends, AFRL project and concept overviews, and qualitative and/or quantitative analyses from events Participate in analytical wargame events and post-wargame data analysis; prepares briefings of post-game outcomes for stakeholders Minimum Qualifications Of Data Analyst Bachelor's degree in a social science or technical field of study and 0-5 years of relevant experience. Candidates are not required to possess all qualifications; if you possess some of the desired qualifications, please apply. Strong communication and writing skills Practical knowledge of Department of Defense (DoD) aircraft and weapon systems. Experience drawing qualitative insights and manipulating quantitative data (using Excel, Python, or similar data analysis tool). Professional operations research knowledge in drawing insights from diverse MS&A scenarios. Experience with engineering, engagement, mission, or campaign level M&S environments is a plus, but not required. Knowledge of the intelligence community and past wargaming participation, such as Red Teaming or planning, is a plus. Demonstrated ability to work independently and in a small team environment. Excellent organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to participate in small, dynamic teams and deliver products exceeding customer expectations. About Us SURVICE Engineering is a nationally recognized, single-source engineering service provider for Government and Industry organizations involved in all phases of the systems engineering process. Our employees are our most valuable asset, and they are proud to have supported the development, testing, analysis, and modeling and simulation (M&S) of many of the major U.S. air, land, and sea combat systems in the field today. They have also contributed their expertise to other vital national defense programs and technologies that involve survivability, cybersecurity, information technology/management, software engineering, unmanned aerial systems (UASs), and metrology/reverse engineering. SURVICE Engineering is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Data Analyst
description: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our team. If you are a data enthusiast with a keen eye for detail and a passion for turning data into actionable insights, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team and help us shape the future with data-driven innovation. Responsibilities: Collate data from internal and external sources and analyze with a holistic approach to monitor and identify changes in trends. Utilize data and analysis results to make recommendations on what action to take to improve origination quality and quantity based on portfolio and market trends. Summarize analysis results in a simplistic way so that it is easy to understand for other teams, including non-technical teams, and management. Use innovative ways to answer data requests when complete data is not available. Provide business with timely reports and/or data support, along with data modeling solutions to the business to assist in decision-making. Work across the enterprise to continuously improve our understanding of data. Make insightful connections on how to piece together new data sets and drive these as inputs to the Risk team's analysis. Collaboration with other team members and departments/stakeholders is very important. Work with Project teams comprising different departments (such as Sales, IT, Project Management, and external vendors) to make system changes as required to implement changes in originations processes. Requirements: Bachelor's degree (or higher) in any field with either an emphasis on quantitative analysis or a strong interest in quantitative analysis work. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills. Strong communication skills with the ability to tell a story about the data in a meaningful way and convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience. At least 2 years of experience with data analysis concepts, intermediate-to-advanced SQL, Python, or SAS. Visualization platforms such as Tableau/PowerBI or any similar visual analytics/reporting tools. Positive attitude with the ability to work on multiple tasks and switch between tasks as required. MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook). Benefits: 401(k). Dental Insurance. Health insurance. Vision insurance. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity, equality, inclusion, and respect for people. The salary will be determined based on several factors including, but not limited to, location, relevant education, qualifications, experience, technical skills, and business needs. Additional Responsibilities: Participate in OrangePeople monthly team meetings, and participate in team-building efforts. Contribute to OrangePeople technical discussions, peer reviews, etc. Contribute content and collaborate via the OP-Wiki/Knowledge Base. Provide status reports to OP Account Management as requested. About us: OrangePeople is an Enterprise Architecture and Project Management solutions company. Our most valuable asset is our people: dynamic, creative thinkers, who are passionate about doing quality work. As a member of the OrangePeople team, you will have access to industry-leading consulting practices, strategies & and technologies, innovative training & and education. An ideal Orange Person is a technology leader with a proven track record of technical achievements and a strong process/methodology orientation.
summary: OrangePeople, an Enterprise Architecture and Project Management solutions company, is seeking a detail-oriented Data Analyst with a strong interest in quantitative analysis to join their team. This role requires strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, along with experience with data analysis concepts, SQL, Python, or SAS, and visualization platforms like Tableau/PowerBI. The ideal candidate will have a positive attitude, the ability to work on multiple tasks, and strong collaboration skills.

title: Data Analyst
description: iWeave™ is a trademarked and patent-pending mobile application that combines entertainment and m-commerce elements to sell premium hair extensions. Users of the app can take a picture of themselves and virtually try-on various hairstyles. They also have the opportunity to share their photo with their friends via SMS or social media. iWeave™ is distinct in the fact that it is the first hair app that allows consumers to go seamlessly from picture-to-purchase. Consumers will receive their hair directly from the warehouse - effectively eliminating the stores and middleman mark-up. iWeave™ represents a merger between the popularity of quality hair extensions and the growth of m-commerce. The app creates a “virtual storefront” for countless independent hair manufacturers and distributors currently in the market. It also serves as a one-stop-shop for customers to select from multiple suppliers. iWeave™ is poised to be the Amazon™ for hair extensions! The hair revolution has begun, and this time, it’s mobile! The Role You Will Be Responsible For Communicating and supporting the use of the data architecture to all stakeholders. Development of data architecture, strategy and governance. Providing secure, stable, scalable and cost-effective solutions to facilitate storage, integration, usage, access, and delivery of data assets across the business. Defining, developing and maintaining reports to support decision making. Processing & Interpreting data to get actionable insights. Working closely with business users to understand their data analysis needs/requirements. Ideal Profile You possess a degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or related field. You have at least 1 year experience, ideally within a Data Analyst or Data Architect role. Ability to conceive the data picture from an organisational perspective, and bridge gap between current state and future goals. Exposure/expertise in one or more of emerging tools like columnar and NoSQL databases, predictive analytics, data visualization, and unstructured data. Strong expertise in data modelling & database design. You have good presentation and communication skills and the ability to present you findings clearly and accessibly in the form of reports and presentations to senior colleagues. You are highly goal driven and work well in fast paced environments You enjoy finding creative solutions to problems You are adaptable and thrive in changing environments What's on Offer? Excellent career development opportunities Flexible working options Opportunity to make a positive impact
summary: iWeave™ is a mobile app that allows users to virtually try on hair extensions and purchase them directly from the app. The app aims to revolutionize the hair extension market by eliminating middlemen and offering a wide selection of products from different suppliers. As a Data Analyst/Architect, you will be responsible for developing and implementing data architecture, strategies, and governance to support the app's growth and success. You will also be involved in data analysis, reporting, and insights generation to inform decision-making.

title: Data Analyst
description: Kane's Furniture is seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join our team! For over 75 years, Kane’s has been resilient in serving Central and South West Florida. Kane’s truly cares about our associates, finding health and wellness very important! Therefore we offer a variety of benefits to ensure health and happiness! We offer standard medical benefits, 401K, associate discount on merchandise, life insurance and many ancillary options tailored to you and your family’s needs! We want YOU to grow your career with US! When you join Kane’s, no matter what the level or role, we will support your path to success in many ways. Kane’s has a proven track record of promoting our associates from within, so come join us! The Data Analyst works closely with CIO and COO to replicate business logic for the Kane’s Furniture systems to prepare reporting for the organization at large and the CEO. Collection, preparation, cleansing, automation functions will be required to synthesize executive summaries and actionable next steps based on historical sales, traffic, HR, and media data. Responsibilities Responsible for extracting and manipulating data sets while monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) to determine business initiatives success. Conduct statistical analysis on sales data with the Kane’s business logic for understanding performance down to a product category, store location and salesperson Manage data reports on initial transaction performance (written sales) as well as final delivered sales across transaction and customer identities. Collaborate and share knowledge with teams across the organization and provide client-facing/non-technical recommendations and insights, as appropriate Develop and maintain internal automated reporting tools, documents, scoring systems Requirements Bachelor’s degree in related field 2-3 years experience in data and analytics field Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel is required Experience with Oracle systems is highly preferred Experience with Postgres is highly preferred Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while meeting deadlines Ability to work during US EST hours on a full time basis Hybrid role - must be able to work in the Pinellas Park Store Support Center office weekly as required Benefits Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance Short Term Disability 401K Paid vacation Generous employee discount Continuous training and development Kane's is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background and drug testing. Kane's is proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.

title: Data Analyst
description: Description Company : We are a leading healthcare organization dedicated to improving patient care and advancing medical research through innovative data analytics. Our mission is to harness the power of data to drive strategic decisions and enhance healthcare outcomes. Location : Remote Position Overview: We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst with experience in SQL, Microsoft Power BI, eClinicalWorks, and IBM Cognos to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise to extract, analyze, and visualize healthcare data, contributing to the enhancement of patient care processes and operational efficiencies. Key Responsibilities Utilize SQL to query and analyze complex healthcare data, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. Develop interactive reports and dashboards in Microsoft Power BI to visualize data trends and insights effectively. Utilize eClinicalWorks to integrate and analyze electronic health records (EHR) data, ensuring compliance with healthcare regulations. Leverage IBM Cognos to create and customize reports, providing actionable insights to stakeholders. Collaborate closely with clinical and operational teams to understand data requirements and optimize analytics solutions. Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency gains based on data-driven insights. Requirements Qualifications : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Healthcare Informatics, or related field. Proven experience in SQL querying, data analysis, and database management. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Power BI for developing reports and dashboards. Hands-on experience with eClinicalWorks or similar EHR systems. Experience in IBM Cognos for report creation and customization. Ability to interpret complex data sets and communicate findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders. Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. Previous experience in healthcare or clinical analytics is advantageous. Why Join Us Opportunity to contribute to groundbreaking healthcare analytics projects. Collaborative and supportive work environment with opportunities for career growth. Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. If you have a passion for leveraging data analytics to drive healthcare innovation and possess the technical skills mentioned above, we encourage you to apply. Help us revolutionize healthcare through advanced analytics. Submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and accomplishments today. Equal Opportunity Employer : We are an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
description: Seeking experienced Data & Analytics Associate – Position Overview KL Scott and Associates is seeking a Data & Analytics Associate that can support our Data Analytics team in current and future client projects. This is a cross-functional role within KLSA’s four primary practice areas: Social Science, Digital Transformation, Organizational Strategy & Support, and Data Management & Analytics. Responsibilities: Implementing data standards and deploys automation tools to extract, synthesize, and validate data from different sources and transform data into usable metrics Supporting operations and conducting data analytics projects to provide information and insights to stakeholders for decision-making or solution development Survey Design, Administration and Analysis. Designing, administering, and analyzing survey questions to ensure they are clear, unbiased, and relevant to the research objectives involving selecting appropriate question types (e.g., multiple-choice, Likert scale, open-ended) and pre-testing the survey to identify and correct any issues before full deployment. Overseeing the distribution of the survey to the target audience, ensuring a representative sample size, and managing the collected data including monitoring response rates, addressing any technical issues, and ensuring data integrity and confidentiality. Analyzing the survey data using statistical tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and insights this includes cleaning and preparing the data, conducting descriptive and inferential analyses, and presenting the findings in comprehensive reports or visualizations that support decision-making and strategic planning. Utilizing scripting and querying tools like Python, R, STATA, or SQL, data visualization/BI tools, statistical methods, and data modeling to produce reports, data files, and dashboards. Developing maturity models to identify key domains and critical success factors, establishing clear maturity levels with detailed descriptors, creating specific assessment criteria, validating through pilot testing and stakeholder feedback, refining the model based on iterative feedback, and ensuring its implementation with proper guidelines and continuous monitoring for relevance and improvement. Constructing data sets, monitors data quality, troubleshoots and resolves database issues to ensure data integrity. Collaborating with stakeholders to understand their needs, objectives, and requirements. Qualifications: Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Statistics and Mathematics, Computer Science or related field. Master’s degree preferred but not required. Proficiency in statistical methods, data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Power BI) and programming languages (such as STATA, SQL, Python, R) is essential Ability to communicate data insights and business strategy, ensuring that analytical solutions align with organizational goals and drive value Ability to create insightful reports, dashboards, and presentations that can be understood by non-technical stakeholders Background in Public Policy within Local, State, and Federal government Experience facilitating workgroups and communities of practice. Strong organizational and time management skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team D&A certifications are a plus (i.e. CAP, Microsoft Data Analyst Associate, SAS Certified Advanced Analytics Professional, IBM Data Analyst Profession Certificate, etc.) Benefits: Competitive salary Health, dental, and vision insurance 401K "Discretionary" PTO Professional development opportunities A dynamic and collaborative work environment Working Conditions: This position may require travel as needed. Some projects may require working extended hours to meet project deadlines. If you are a results-driven professional and have the above qualifications, we encourage you to apply for the Data & Analytics Associate position. Join our team and contribute to our continued growth and success. K.L. Scott & Associates is committed to diversity and inclusion and welcomes candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
summary: KL Scott and Associates is seeking a Data & Analytics Associate to support their Data Analytics team in current and future client projects. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in statistical methods, data visualization tools (such as Tableau or Power BI), and programming languages (such as STATA, SQL, Python, R). They will also have experience in survey design, administration, and analysis, as well as developing maturity models. The role involves collaborating with stakeholders, constructing data sets, and ensuring data integrity.

title: Data Analyst - Data Governance Analyst
description: Primary Location: Jackson, Mississippi V-Soft Consulting is currently hiring for a Data Analyst - Data Governance Analyst for our premier client in Jackson, Mississippi . Knowledge, Skills And Abilities » Proficiency in Microsoft 365 applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams) and Adobe. What You’ll Do Job Responsibilities: Microsoft Purview Oversight Serve as the primary compliance contact for the implementation and oversight of the agency’s Microsoft Purview application. Microsoft Purview is a data governance tool that helps organizations map, manage, and govern their data across various sources. Data types to be brought under Purview oversight and management include: data/files within enterprise Microsoft 365 applications (Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive, Teams, Exchange, etc.) and other on-premises, multicloud, and software as a service (SaaS) data. Data cover a range of public health subject matters such as: disease surveillance and reporting, environmental health (water supply, wastewater, food protection, etc.), vital records and statistics, and professional and healthcare facility licensure, just to name a few. Receive and log incoming data and public records requests from non-media parties. Ensure requests are properly documented and tracked for timely processing. Legal Review And Redaction Assist in legal review of requested documents to determine necessary redactions to protect sensitive information before release as public records. Ensure compliance with legal requirements and agency policies regarding public records disclosures. Data Retrieval And Compilation Coordinate with relevant departments or personnel to retrieve requested data and compile necessary documents for disclosure. Ensure completeness and accuracy of information provided in response to requests. Interested? Qualified candidates should send their resumes to dchoudhary@vsoftconsulting.com V-Soft Consulting Group is recognized among the top 100 fastest growing staffing companies in North America, V-Soft Consulting Group is headquartered in Louisville, KY with strategic locations in India, Canada and the U.S. V-Soft is known as an agile, innovative technology services company holding several awards and distinctions and has a wide variety of partnerships across diverse technology stacks. As a valued V-Soft Consultant, you’re eligible for full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision), a 401(k) plan, competitive compensation and more. V-Soft is partnered with numerous Fortune 500 companies, exceptionally positioned to advance your career growth. V-Soft Consulting provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. For more information or to view all our open jobs, please visit www.vsoftconsulting.com or call (844) 425-8425.

title: Senior Data Analyst
description: Exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst with extensive Investment banking experience!! In this role you will work 3 days/week in the Boston, MA office. Position Overview : The Data Analyst works as part of the Data Platform Team within the Data & Analytics Group. The primary responsibilities are to analyze enterprise and vendor datasets, understand data characteristics and methodologies, and collaborate across business and technology teams to manage data onboarding and data lifecycle. The analyst will work on analyzing data profiles and data cleansing and quality check requirements, working with the dev team to build and enhance data pipelines while maintaining proper quality and control around the data sets. Primary Responsibilities: Collaborate across teams to implement data governance policies for data ingestion and operational processes. Manage data sets to the defined rules and controls. Develop/implement new rules and controls as needed. Remediate data issues. Address quality issues surfaced in the data set, engage vendors and stakeholders where necessary. Define data policies and controls for new data requirements. Analyze and document data methodologies and data feed structures related to internal and external data sources. Provide Data Ownership and subject matter expertise for reference data and aggregate data. Provide data quality metrics for guidance on Enterprise data sets. Establish working relationship with key stakeholders and manage stakeholder expectations. Provide thought leadership and participate in projects that enhance/improve data life cycles, processes, quality, and governance. Identify and document data quality problems and opportunities to improve data quality controls via data profiling and advanced analysis. Document, assess, influence, and synthesize business requirements to develop and advance data platform and stewardship capabilities. Translate complex business requirements into focused technical requirements and data solutions. Conduct detailed UAT against complex requirements and data structures. Work closely with developers to resolve issues discovered via testing and develop solutions to address logic/design deficiencies. Key Qualifications / Skills: Extensive hands-on experience analyzing and interpreting investment data with strong knowledge of the Investment Management industry 10+ years of Investment Management experience. Comprehensive data analysis skills with ability to detect anomalies, patterns, and data quality issues. Strong SQL skills Experience with Snowflake is a plus. Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively in both formal and informal contexts tailored for the audience. Knowledge of Data Governance & Data Quality and the relevant tools. Hands-on experience in project management Ability to manage enterprise scale data projects. Preferred Skills: Experience working with BI reporting tools like Tableau or Power BI is preferred. Knowledge in coding, Python is a plus. Familiar with agile process and JIRA

Create true bookings-to-billings waterfall and integrate with backlog reporting. Create and maintain RCM revenue forecast. Maintain and analyze RCM capacity and productivity model. Perform price increase data analytics work. Support advanced GTM analytics requiring SQL (conversation and win rates by create date cohort and product) Fuse KPIs into management dashboard and keep updated in real-time. Run queries on SQL database What you need: 2+ years’ BI & Data experience Strong querying skills SaaS experience SQL experience Working with Finance teams Excellent communication skills for effective stakeholder engagement What we’d like to see: SaaS sector experience Previous experience in a PE-backed business Salesforce experience Salary: $100,000 - $150,000 Location: Boston, MA Benefits: Unlimited PTO 6% 401(k) Hybrid working Full healthcare covered If you are interested about this exceptional opportunity, please connect with Sean for further details. title: Marketing Data & Insights Analyst
description: This position is responsible for analyzing and reporting on our Marketing activity across all our channels. This position will play a key role in supporting our cross-functional marketing functions, including expanding our performance reporting, identifying opportunities for improving spend efficiencies, and delivering actionable insights about our customers. Minimum Eligibility Requirements: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Marketing, Statistics, or Computer Science (relevant experience can be substituted for the required education on the basis of one calendar year of experience for one academic year of education). 2-5 years of relevant experience required or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company. Expertise working with large datasets, from data mining & analysis to building visualizations and dashboards via BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau. Proficiency in SQL. Experience with R and/or Python a bonus. Experience in CRM / database marketing / customer data analysis. Demonstrated knowledge of statistics. Understanding of testing methodology & best practices a plus. Demonstrated ability to translate data into clear conclusions, with a data-driven approach to business problem solving. Able to clearly communicate complex analyses to non-technical audiences. Demonstrated experience performing offline & online campaign analyses. Experience building visualizations and dashboards via business intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, etc. Must be highly analytical and enjoy working with data. Must be able to work independently as well as cross functionally with multiple teams, juggling multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Proficiency in SQL required; familiarity with R or Python a plus. Experience with web analytics in general & Google Analytics specifically a plus. Ability to multi-task and work quickly to support multiple business stakeholders. Personal integrity, humility, and an appreciation for the power of true teamwork. Must pass pre-employment background check. Essential Job Functions: Quickly become subject matter expert in all areas of marketing analytics and how to best leverage its value, including leading cross-channel analyses from multiple data platforms and staying abreast of industry trends and best practices. Support cross-functional stakeholders by leading measurement strategy, KPI selection, and methodology to determine incremental value. Work with media, digital marketing & CRM teams to understand how marketing campaigns influence customer journey & business outcomes. Partner with Marketing/CRM team to support strategy & execution, leading directly & measurably to superior marketing efficiency and incremental revenue. Present findings to relevant business stakeholders including executive audiences. Build & maintain intuitive, action-oriented dashboards & visualizations to enhance business understanding, decision-making and self-service capabilities. Proactively identify strategic opportunities & provide recommendations based on ad hoc data exploration of our marketing data. Perform extensive and self-directed analyses that lead directly to actionable insights. Conduct consumer research around our brand & customer experience. ID & bridge reporting & data gaps between marketing activity and measurement capabilities. Advocate best practices for marketing campaign data collection across all offline & digital channels. Working Conditions (travel & environment) Travel may be required including air and car travel The noise level in the work environment is typically quiet to moderate. title: Cerner Data Analyst
description: Job Summary: The Cerner Data Extraction Specialist will be responsible for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from the Cerner EHR system to support clinical, operational, and financial reporting needs. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with Cerner databases, strong SQL skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with various stakeholders to meet organizational goals. Key Responsibilities: Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from the Cerner EHR system into data warehouses or other reporting platforms. Develop and maintain SQL queries, scripts, and procedures to support data extraction and reporting requirements. Collaborate with clinical, operational, and financial teams to understand data needs and ensure accurate and timely data delivery. Ensure data integrity and quality by performing regular data validation and verification processes. Troubleshoot and resolve data extraction issues, working closely with IT and Cerner support teams as needed. Document data extraction processes, including data sources, transformation logic, and data mapping. Participate in data governance initiatives to ensure compliance with data security and privacy regulations. Stay current with Cerner updates and enhancements, assessing their impact on data extraction processes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Health Informatics, or a related field. Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data extraction and analysis, preferably in a healthcare setting. Proficiency in SQL and experience with SQL Server or other relational database management systems. Strong understanding of Cerner EHR system architecture, databases, and data models. Experience with ETL tools and processes. Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams. Knowledge of data governance and compliance standards in healthcare, including HIPAA. Preferred Skills: Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView. Familiarity with other healthcare information systems and interoperability standards (e.g., HL7, FHIR). Certification in Cerner Millennium or related Cerner modules. Project management experience or certification.
summary: The Cerner Data Extraction Specialist is responsible for extracting, transforming, and loading (ETL) data from the Cerner EHR system to support reporting needs. The ideal candidate will have experience with Cerner databases, strong SQL skills, and collaboration skills.

title: Data Analyst
description: OUR STORY Quince was started to challenge the existing idea that nice things should cost a lot. Our mission was simple: create an item of equal or greater quality than the leading luxury brands and sell them at a much lower price. OUR VALUES EVERYONE SHOULD BE ABLE TO AFFORD NICE THINGS. Quality shouldn’t be a luxury. We’re proud of our mission to bring the world’s highest quality goods to people at affordable prices. QUALITY IS MORE THAN MATERIALS. True quality is a combination of premium materials and high production standards. WE FOCUS ON THE ESSENTIALS. From the perfect crewneck sweater to hotel quality sheets, we're all about high quality essentials that bring enjoyment to daily life. WE’RE INNOVATING TO MAKE UNREAL PRICES A REALITY. Our uniquely developed factory-direct model lets us offer exceptionally high quality goods for much lower prices than our competitors. ALWAYS A BETTER DEAL. We believe in real price transparency, for both our customers and factory partners. This way, everyone gets a better deal. FAIR FACTORIES. We are committed to working with factories that meet the global standards for workplace safety and wage fairness. OUR TEAM AND SUCCESS Quince is a retail and technology company co-founded by a team that has extensive experience in retail, technology and building early stage companies. You’ll work with a team of world-class talent from Stanford GSB, Wish.com, D.E. Shaw, Stitch Fix, Urban Outfitters, Wayfair, McKinsey, Nike etc. THE IDEAL CANDIDATE The ideal candidate is a self-starter, problem-solver and successful in combining technology and data into best-in-class outcomes. The candidate is energized by solving complex business problems and consistently effective in making high-judgment decisions at rapid pace amidst the frequent ambiguity that comes with charting a course of action with no precedent. Moreover, the ideal candidate is energized by an environment where strategy, innovation and decision-making are intentionally distributed, where candor, speed and data are highly valued and colleagues at all levels hold each other to unusually high standards on behalf of Quince customers. Quince is seeking a dynamic individual to be an integral part of our Ecommerce team as an Ecommerce Analyst. As an Ecommerce Analyst at Quince, you will play a pivotal role in driving growth and optimizing the Quince ecommerce experience through data-driven insights and strategic analysis. You will be responsible for translating data into actionable recommendations to enhance customer engagement, increase conversions, and drive revenue growth. Responsibilities Translate data into critical insights to unlock growth across the Quince ecommerce experience Perform comprehensive analysis of customer behavior on the site and the conversion funnel to make recommendations and implement strategies for improvement Own strategy and development of daily, weekly, and monthly dashboard for reporting both within the ecommerce team and to the Quince leadership Serve as business owner of ecommerce data, ensure comprehensive and accurate event and data capture Support A/B and MV testing, methodology, results analysis, and recommendations Perform ad hoc issue investigation and quantification of business impact Perform ROI analysis to assess the impact of different initiatives in informing the ecommerce roadmap Stay up-to-date on the latest ecommerce trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for growth Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Applied Mathematics) preferred 2-5 years of relevant experience in data analytics with a focus in ecommerce and a deep understanding of the ecommerce conversion funnel Strong analytical skills and ability to communicate complex data (including experience with Looker) Strong proficiency in SQL and Excel Excellent written and oral communication skills, including an ability to communicate across business areas Ability to prioritize and deliver on multiple threads of work in a fast-paced environment Strong personal work ethic, including personal initiative and ownership Quince seeks to build high-performing teams of people from various experiences and backgrounds who can collectively push our company into new realms. We seek a diverse pool of applicants and consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, citizenship, disability, Veteran status, marital status, or any other protected status. If you have a special need or disability that requires accommodation, please let us know. Security Advisory: Beware of Frauds At Quince, we're dedicated to recruiting top talent who share our drive for innovation. To safeguard candidates, Quince emphasizes legitimate recruitment practices. Initial communication is primarily via official Quince email addresses and LinkedIn; beware of deviations. Personal data and sensitive information will not be solicited during the application phase. Interviews are conducted via phone, in person, or through the approved platforms Google Meets or Zoom—never via messaging apps or other calling services. Offers are merit-based, communicated verbally, and followed up in writing. If personal information is requested to initiate the hiring process, rest assured it will be through secure and protected means.
summary: Quince, a retail and technology company, seeks an Ecommerce Analyst to drive growth and optimize its ecommerce experience. title: Business Insights, Data Analyst
description: Business Insights, Data Analyst Hatfield, PA Position supports two sites and candidates must be able to travel to our sites as needed COMPANY SUMMARY Inverness Graham, a Philadelphia based buyout firm that acquires innovative companies where technology is transforming traditional industry, has created a new Life Sciences and Diagnostics platform with the acquisitions of Electron Microscopy Sciences (EMS) and Azer Scientific. Founded in 1969, EMS is the most comprehensive source for all microscopy and general laboratory research fields. Azer Scientific was founded in 2003 and has grown into a leading healthcare supplier serving histology laboratories. The two brands share a common mission to partner with customers to drive service innovation within the life sciences and diagnostic industries and, today, serve customers across 100 countries. POSITION SUMMARY In this role, you will be responsible for converting complex data into actionable insights. You will be responsible for depth trend analysis, constructing predictive models, developing impactful dashboards and data products, and effectively communicating findings to steer strategic decision-making. Through close collaboration with cross-functional teams, the successful candidate will drive process enhancements and pinpoint lucrative growth opportunities, making a significant impact on the organization’s success. You will work closely with internal teams, using data to push continuous improvement in their processes and projects. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS Provide services and data analysis to business units departments and extract information and analysis for the local company, including collecting industry data. Drive the tactical and strategic commercial effectiveness activities with cross-functional collaboration in the affiliate to ensure alignment with the business strategy and optimum resource allocation. Generate monthly reports raising issues for follow-up and monitoring development and yearly calculations. Manage all product and multi-channel customer engagement data and build main insights dashboards in an accessible system and ensure that all relevant functions understand and apply customer engagement processes appropriately. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address business opportunities and articulate known problems that data analytics can solve. Create and maintain predictive models and machine-learning algorithms to support business goals and untap business potential. Collaborate with data owners and business stakeholders to identify data elements to address reporting requirements. Be able to challenge, validate and authenticate data sources and strive to be the owner of one source of truth. SKILLS AND ABILITIES Business and industry understanding and the ability to share your findings using impactful visualization and efficient communication. Good presentation skills and knowledge of design and implementation of new dashboards. Excellent communication skills. EDUCATION Bachelor’s degree or Bachelor of Sciences. (preferably in Economics, Industrial & Management Engineering, Computer Science, or Statistics). MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst with a focus on customer engagement. 2 years of experience with SQL, Python (or R), MS Excel, or other tools to analyze data efficiently for complex analysis and problem-solving. Experience with BI tools. Demonstrated expertise in conducting comprehensive business performance analysis. Ability to interpret data insights and communicate them effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong command of statistical analysis techniques, with a track record of applying advanced methodologies to derive meaningful conclusions from complex datasets. In-depth understanding of best practices in presenting data, ensuring that insights are communicated in a clear, compelling, and actionable manner. Experience with one or more of the following: Forecasting models, sales performance analysis, customer insights, and operations data analysis, such as inventory optimization. Exposure to or experience in building machine learning models to predict trends and behaviors applied in a business context. description: Job Title: EPIC Clarity Data Analyst Location: New Jersey / On-site no more than once per month Type of Job: This is a C2H (Contract-to-Hire) position Job Summary: Our Healthcare client in New Jersey is seeking a skilled EPIC Clarity Data Analyst to be part of a cross-functional team composed of product owners, business analysts, and dashboard developers. The role will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing complex queries to feed into dashboards and reports that support data-driven decision making across the organization. This role requires a deep understanding of Epic’s Cogito offerings, specifically related to the Revenue Data model, and possess the ability to translate business requirements into actionable insights. Essential Job Functions: Develop, maintain, and optimize data models within the enterprise data lake to support revenue cycle analytics. Work closely with product owners, business analysts, and dashboard developers to understand reporting requirements and ensure data models meet business needs. Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and insights that can drive revenue optimization and operational improvements. Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data used in reports and dashboards that provide clear, actionable insights for stakeholders. Perform ad hoc data analysis and reporting tasks to support business needs and strategic initiatives. Document data models, processes, and workflows to ensure clarity and scalability. Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision making across the organization. Work collaboratively with other members of the team to ensure effective delivery of data solutions and services. Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to Epic and its Cogito suite of tools. Ensure all data handling and reporting activities comply with relevant regulatory and organizational standards. Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Healthcare Administration, or a related field. Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in data modeling or analytics within the healthcare industry. Current Epic Certification - Cogito, Caboodle, and/or Clarity. Proficiency in SQL and data modeling tools. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment. Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred: Current Epic Revenue Data Model certification. A strong understanding of Epic workflows pertaining to the entire Revenue Cycle lifecycle. Knowledge and application of project management disciplines in a complex environment. Experience observing stakeholders and workflows to learn about underlying problems and potential solutions. Experience with Agile Development methods and tools. Excellent written and oral communication skills. Licenses and Certifications Required: Epic Cogito Certification Epic Clarity Data Model Certification Licenses and Certifications Preferred: Epic Revenue Data Model Certification Certified Health Data Analyst (CHDA) Certification HFMA Certified Specialist Business Intelligence (CSBI)
summary: A Healthcare client in New Jersey is seeking a skilled EPIC Clarity Data Analyst to join a cross-functional team focused on data-driven decision making. The role involves developing, maintaining, and optimizing complex queries for dashboards and reports, requiring a deep understanding of Epic’s Cogito offerings, particularly the Revenue Data model. Responsibilities include data modeling, analysis, and reporting to support revenue cycle optimization and operational improvements.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: U.S. News & World Report is a multifaceted digital media company dedicated to helping citizens, consumers, business leaders and policy officials make important decisions in their lives. We publish independent reporting, rankings, data journalism and advice that has earned the trust of our readers and users for nearly 90 years. Our platforms on usnews.com include Education, Health, Money, Travel, Cars, News and 360 Reviews. We reach more than 40 million people monthly during moments when they are most in need of expert advice and motivated to act on that advice directly on our platforms. Our signature franchises include our “Best” series of consumer guides on colleges, graduate schools, hospitals, diets, cars, financial services and more. These guides provide an easy-to-digest list for consumers to better understand and compare when making their decisions. We continue to publish annual guides of the authoritative Best Colleges and Best Hospitals rankings on our website and in print. And our U.S. News Live flagship conferences highlight important national conversations including Healthcare of Tomorrow and Healthiest Communities. We believe in having a broad range of talent and backgrounds at U.S. News. We strive to maintain a welcoming workplace where everyone is given an opportunity to succeed and contribute to their fullest. Learn more about our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion initiative. Are you up to the challenge? Use web analytics tools (Google Analytics, Google Ad Manager, ComScore) to gather data, analyze it, and develop actionable insights and recommendations. Create and maintain automated KPI reports for stakeholders to view daily, weekly, monthly Create visualizations and dashboards that provide connections between web engagement, page speed and revenue Work with data architects to implement new dashboards that pull data from various sources (including BigQuery) Partner with technical teams to appropriately tag the website (metadata and event tracking) Take ownership over web analytics and documentation. Continually QA and update tracking systems as needed to make sure we are measuring our audience accurately and in ways that help drive smart business decisions. Audit, investigate, and resolve any tracking issues with external partners Requirements You should definitely have: 3 years of Business Intelligence or Digital Analytics experience Experience using a visualization tool such as Google Looker Studio, Looker, etc. Able to translate business requirements into technical solutions for tracking using Google Analytics or other Digital Analytics tool Knowledge of Tag Managers, preferably Tealium Experience in at least one scripting language (Python, R, etc.) and SQL Understanding of Javascript and how it is utilized for web tracking Comfortable working with different departments and collaborating with developers Experience in Excel (pivot tables, index match, sumifs, etc.) It would be nice if you had: Familiarity with Brightspot CMS Knowledge of GA4 Experience forecasting (using R or other forecasting tools) What it’s like to work with us: Talent is our best asset! We invest in people with passion and potential who understand U.S. News’ dedication to our consumers. Entrepreneurial, mission-driven culture with core values of quality and integrity Focus on fostering personal and professional growth Competitive benefits including paid vacation time, medical, tuition reimbursement, and training Collaborative Work Environment ~ Fun, diverse, inclusive and ambitious co-workers Other Job Info: These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this job. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees assigned to this job. Preference for New York or Washington, DC based applicants to work a hybrid schedule in those office locations. U.S. News & World Report strongly encourages all employees to be fully vaccinated (including boosters). In New York City, the anticipated base salary for this position is $55,000 -$75,000. The actual base salary offered will depend on a variety of factors, including without limitation, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, interview performance, and if applicable, the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.
summary: U.S. News & World Report is seeking a Digital Analytics Specialist to gather data, analyze it, and develop actionable insights and recommendations. Responsibilities include creating automated KPI reports, developing visualizations and dashboards, partnering with technical teams on website tagging, and taking ownership of web analytics and documentation. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or Digital Analytics, experience using a visualization tool like Google Looker Studio or Looker, and knowledge of Tag Managers, preferably Tealium. Experience in scripting languages like Python or R and SQL, understanding of Javascript, and familiarity with Brightspot CMS are highly desirable.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE )
description: Data Analyst 100% Remote Initial budget through the end of the year- Will likely continue extending Description of the project: End to End (E2E) Fresh Cold Chain Data Team What are the primary goals and deliverables expected from this project?. Team will be part of the E2E Fresh domain. E2E Fresh is responsible for perishable products like produce, meat, seafood and dairy. Specifically, this team will be responsible for data related to refrigerated supply chain, or Cold Chain as we call it. Cold Chain data includes data from temperature sensors, purchase orders, warehousing, and transportation routing and location. The overall goal is to use this data increase freshness of food at the stores. Ingestion pipelines for data from internal and external applications. Curation and presentation of application data to internal consumers. Join data from multiple systems to create Fresh Domain Data. " Investigate and mitigate data quality issues. The Journey Of Data Enabling E2E Fresh Will Usually Follow a Path Of Analytics To Client Improvement Opportunities, Reporting To Allow Operations To Target Improvement, And Event (real-time) Data To Participate In Operations. A Hypothetical Example Would Be " Analytics reveals that strawberries are frequently subjected to high temperatures in transit from distribution center to stores. Management knows they have a problem and assigns operations to investigate. " Reports are given to operations managers to help them investigate and try an operational change like a temp check when the truck leaves the yard. Reports allow them to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the change on strawberry freshness. " The changes might mitigate some instances but not all. So transportation and/or stores are given real time data. This will allow them to be alerted that a truck is en route to the store with a high temperature. They turn the truck around before it even hits the store's loading dock and a replacement order is processed. This saves employee time and speeds up the replenishment process, resulting in fresher strawberries in the store. What is the start date and expected duration?: ASAP start (ideally 6/24). Team will be durable for the foreseeable future. End date listed is just end of FY. Expect this team to continue next FY. NOTE: Hiring manager is on vacation Are there key milestones or deadlines that the team should be aware of?: KTD uses the OKR management model and for this upcoming quarter there is some discovery and ingestion. But typically the deliverables will be: integration pipelines of data sources, cross-domain data set creation, presentation of data via data lake or API. Candidate Meeting Time Block (reserved time on your calendar to meet with candidates): Potentially 6/28, 7/1. Manager would like to meet with Data Tech Lead candidates and Data Analyst candidates. May include 2 others from the team to participate in candidate meetings. Any specific location requirements?: Team members will be fully remote and can be anywhere in the US. Team will keep NA Eastern Time hours. This can't be listed as contract-to-hire because there are currently no FTE openings for these to be converted into. Specific Technical Skills extensive knowledge of data principals, patterns, processes and practices Databricks SQL Python GCP Team will have dedicated product manager and be directly supported by scrum master, solution architect and data architect.
summary: This is a 100% remote Data Analyst role for an E2E Fresh Cold Chain Data team. The team focuses on improving the freshness of food in stores by analyzing data from temperature sensors, purchase orders, warehousing, and transportation. Responsibilities include ingesting data from various sources, curating and presenting data to internal stakeholders, joining data from different systems, investigating and mitigating data quality issues, and contributing to the team's overall goal of enhancing food freshness.

title: Data Analyst
description: Where compassion meets innovation and technology and our employees are family. Thank you for your interest in joining our team! Please review the job information below. THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION GENERAL PURPOSE OF JOB At this level, Data Analysts learn and perform specialized systems and reporting tasks, under supervision, with some latitude for independent action. The objectives at this level are simple report writing, data validation, and end user education. Incumbents report to the Alternative Payment Strategies Manager and will be assigned a focus area: Hospital/Clinics (with focus on Financial, Operational and Clinical Areas) or Health Plan within the Driscoll Health System (DHS). ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES - Positions in this class may perform any or all of the below listed duties. These should be interpreted as examples of the work and are not necessarily all-inclusive . Follows the Driscoll Way with communication, end user engagement, and customer service at all times. Follows all guidelines for PHI and data management. Ability to run, export and review reports and data within. Create and run basic SQL/SAS query and has understanding of data models within their assigned focus area. Is or becomes proficient in Excel, including pivot tables, Power Query, Dashboards, etc. Engagement with end users: provide report training, assist with report scoping/requirements, helps generate report specifications and checklists. Maintains and assists teams with Alternative Payment Strategies Department website, Analytics catalog, Reporting portals, etc. Can build simple reports in SSMS/SSRS, Epic, maintains incentive model (letter and forms), or other DHS software tools. Learns and develops basic knowledge/skills for Data Visualizations (PowerBI, SlicerDicer, Radar Dashboards, Excel Dashboards) This position has the opportunity to advance into a Business Intelligence Developer or Advanced Healthcare Data Analyst position. Performs other related work as required. EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE - Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities is qualifying. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required, Degree in related field preferred (Degree in the fields such as Finance, Statistics, Data Mining and Analytics, Clinical Analytics, or Health Care Administration) Familiarity in analytics, report development, data visualization applications or other data tools is favored.
summary: Data Analyst role at Driscoll Health System focused on reporting, data validation, and end user education.  The role involves creating basic SQL/SAS queries, using Excel and other data tools for visualizations, and assisting with the development of reporting portals.  The position offers opportunities to advance to Business Intelligence Developer or Advanced Healthcare Data Analyst.

title: Data Analyst
description: United Energy Solar in Gainesville, FL is looking to hire a full-time Data Analyst to perform data entry tasks by logging customers' information using spreadsheets. This is NOT a remote position and requires the applicant to live in or near Gainesville, FL. Do you have excellent attention to detail? Would you enjoy an entry-level office job with one of the nation's best and brightest companies ? If so, please read on! This position earns a competitive salary of $35,000/year . We provide great benefits , including health insurance for qualified individuals, sales contests, incentives, and opportunities for advancement . We also offer our Data Analysts dental, vision, company-paid life insurance, short- and long-term disability, paid vacation, holidays, sick days, and a flexible spending account . If this sounds like the right entry-level data entry opportunity for you, apply to work at our office today! About United Energy Solar We are a thriving energy services company that provides solar options for home and commercial projects as well as storage battery solutions. From start to finish, we offer our clients a dedicated expert who helps them every step of the way, from design to installation to outstanding cost savings. As one of the fastest-growing companies in America, we believe the future is bright and full of possibilities. Our mission is to empower the people of the world by providing access to cleaner, more affordable energy. Our team of veteran solar specialists is committed to simplifying solar, which makes the process easy for our clients and our employees. We're also committed to making our company a sought-after place to work. Along with our excellent benefits and perks , we provide our employees with daily training and support . We also foster a great company culture that has made us one of the nation's best and brightest companies to work for. A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A DATA ANALYST As a Data Analyst, your efforts help us improve our business model, resulting in more satisfied customers! Each day, you log customer cancellations and research customer complaints. Thorough and detail-oriented, you investigate issues and document your findings. You facilitate productive communication between our owner and our supplier partners to resolve problems. You know that tracking analytics is a key element of a solid business development strategy, which is why you faithfully input data into Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel spreadsheets. Trustworthy and discrete, you maintain a high level of confidentiality when creating reports that deal with our customers' personal information. You enjoy having a job where your organizational skills are valued ! Qualifications For a Data Analyst Computer proficiency, including advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets Ability to operate standard office equipment Report writing or database management/administration Must live in or near Gainesville, FL Administrative or data entry experience is preferred but not required. Experience in the energy industry would be a plus! Are you a self-motivated person who demonstrates initiative? Can you effectively prioritize multiple tasks while meeting deadlines? Are you focused and attentive to detail? If yes, you might just be perfect for this entry-level office job! ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM? If you'd enjoy performing data entry tasks and feel that you would be right for this entry-level job, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application . We look forward to meeting you! Location: 32608 Salary: $35000 per year Job Posted by ApplicantPro
summary: United Energy Solar is looking for a Data Analyst to perform data entry tasks, log customer information, and research customer complaints. The role requires strong attention to detail, proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets, and the ability to prioritize multiple tasks. This entry-level position offers a competitive salary, benefits, and opportunities for advancement.

title: Program Analyst (Data Analyst)
description: Please see announcement on USAJOBS for available locations. Summary Customs & Border Protection (CBP): Securing America's Borders The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) is calling on those who want to help protect American interests and secure our Nation. DHS Components work collectively to prevent terrorism; secure borders and our transportation systems; protect the President and other dignitaries; enforce and administer immigration laws; safeguard cyberspace; and ensure resilience to disasters. We achieve these vital missions through a diverse workforce spanning hundreds of occupations. Make an impact; join DHS. Discover a challenging and rewarding career with U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP), the sole organization responsible for securing the nation's borders. At CBP, we: Secure and facilitate trade and travel while enforcing hundreds of U.S. regulations, including immigration and drug laws Screen passengers, vehicles, and shipments entering our country Seize illegal narcotics, vehicles, and agricultural products and prohibited goods. Prevent unauthorized entry into the country Rescue individuals who fall into dangerous conditions traversing our border Find us on Twitter at @CBP and @CBPJobs Find us on LinkedIn at U.S. Customs and Border Protection CBP employees demonstrate the highest level of commitment to protect and serve the United States of America and to exemplify the CBP Core Values of Vigilance, Service to Country and Integrity. Learn more about CBP's mission, core values and careers at https://www.cbp.gov/about Duties Joining Customs & Border Protection (CBP), Office of Accountability, Analysis Integration Division, will allow you to utilize your expertise in providing analytics expertise to program offices and offices across CBP. This position starts at a salary of $103,409.00 (GS-13, Step 1) to $134,435.00 (GS-13, Step 10). Apply for this exciting opportunity to strengthen the Department's ability to perform homeland security functions by serving as an expert analyst on current analytical tools and techniques, advising on analytical challenges, and improving analytics within CBP. Salary: Salary reflects the Rest of U.S. scale and will be adjusted to meet the locality pay of the duty location upon selection. GS Salary: Visit this link to view the locality pay tables by geographic area. If you do not see your geographic area listed, select the "Rest of United States" pay table. Some positions fall under a special pay rate depending on the series, grade level and location of the position. Please visit this link to view special pay rate charts. In this Program Analyst position you will become a key team member of Homeland Security professionals involved in planning, developing, monitoring, and coordinating data analytics projects relating to high visibility cross-component issues to resolve critical policy, and resourcing issues; analyzing agency administrative mission-orientated programs; and recommending and applying new hypotheses and concepts to improve effectiveness and efficiency of operations. Typical Work assignments include: Applying data management and analysis techniques to study, gather, interpret, develop and report on CBP operational, policy, and resource data. Developing forecasting and cost-benefit models for budget planning purposes. Conducting analytics projects, which include preparing requirements and developing new or modifying existing processes. Providing technical advice to agency management officials and develops plans for agency programs, operations, objective, policies and procedures. Implementing and coordinating development of dashboards such as Resource Performance Tool (RPT) within the Analysis Integration Division (AID) for use throughout CBP. How To Apply Please read the entire announcement and all the instructions before you begin an application. To apply and be considered for this position, you must complete all required questionnaires, assessments and submit all required documentation as specified in the How to Apply and Required Documents section. All application materials, including transcripts, must be in English. The complete application package must be submitted by 11:59 PM (ET) on 07/15/2024 to receive consideration. The application process is as follows: Click the Apply Online button. Answer the questions presented in the application and attach all necessary supporting documentation. Click the Submit Application button prior to 11:59 PM (ET) on the announcement 07/15/2024. If you are required to complete any USA Hire Assessments, you will be notified after submitting your application. The notification will be provided in your application submission screen via email. The notification will include your unique assessment access link to the USA Hire system and the completion deadline. Additionally, in USAJOBS you can click "Track this application" to return to your assessment completion notice. Access USA Hire using your unique assessment link. Access is granted through your USAJOBS login credentials. Review all instructions prior to beginning your assessments. You will have the opportunity to request a testing accommodation before beginning the assessments should you have a disability covered under the Rehabilitation Action of 1973 as amended. Set aside at least 3 hours to take these assessments; however, most applicants complete the assessments in less time. If you need to stop the assessments and continue at a later time, you can re-use your unique assessment link. Your responses to the USA Hire Assessments will be reused for one year (in most cases) from the date you complete an assessment. If future application you submit require completion of the same assessments, your responses will be automatically reused. For more general information, system requirements, reasonable accommodation information, and to request assistance regarding the USA Hire Assessments, review the following resources: USA Hire Assessments. To update your application, including supporting documentation: During the announcement open period, return to your USAJOBS account, find your application record and click Edit my application. This option will no longer be available once the announcement has closed. To view the announcement status or your application status: Click on How to See your Application and Job Status. Your application status page is where you can view your application status, USA Hire assessment completion status, and review your notifications sent by the hiring agency regarding your application. Applications and supporting documentation will not be accepted by mail or email. The address below is for inquiries only. You may apply more than once, but the most recent application is the only one that will be used. You must submit your resume, your online questionnaire, and any supporting documents by 11:59 PM Eastern Time on 07/15/2024. It is your responsibility to verify that any information entered or uploaded is received and is accurate. Human Resources will not modify or change any part of your application. Determining your eligibility and qualifications is dependent on the supporting documentation and information provided, which may impact your referral for further consideration. DHS offers competitive salaries and an attractive benefits package, including: health, dental, vision, life, and long-term care insurance; retirement plan; Thrift Savings Plan [similar to a 401(k)]; Flexible Spending Account; Employee Assistance Program; personal leave days; and paid federal holidays. Other benefits may include: flexible work schedules; telework; tuition reimbursement; transportation subsidies; uniform allowance; health and wellness programs; and fitness centers. DHS is committed to employee development and offers a variety of employee training and developmental opportunities. For more information visit, DHS Careers website and select "Benefits." Disabled veteran leave will be available to any Federal employee hired on or after November 5, 2016, who is a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 30 percent or more. In accordance with 5 U.S. Code 9202(c) and 5 C.F.R 920.201 certain positions are exempt from the provisions of the Fair Chance to Compete Act. Applicants who believe they have been subjected to a violation of the Fair Chance to Compete for Jobs Act, may submit a written complaint to hc-recordsmgmt@cbp.dhs.gov.
